64 2021-05-04 respiratory failure, acute respiratory failure 4/10/21-Patient presented to an outlying hospital ED w/acute N/V/D and abdominal pain. She was found... Read more
Close
4/10/21-Patient presented to an outlying hospital ED w/acute N/V/D and abdominal pain. She was found to have pancreatitis and was found to be SARS-CoV-2 with screening for admission. She had a history of symptomatic COVID with a positive NP swab 1/2/21. Because the patient had no respiratory symptoms she was considered "asymptomatic." She rapidly progressed to having severe necrotizing pancreatitis. She was transferred to tertiary care center where she remains hospitalized. Her hospitalization has been complicated by acute hypoxic and hypercapnic respiratory failure requiring intubation x 24 hours. She had mental status changes and an MRI revealed posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome, acute kidney injury, splenic vein thrombosis -parital occlusion.
64 2021-05-06 shortness of breath right breast pain; Shoulder pain; can't move shoulder/ can't move her arm/ her shoulder is immobile;... Read more
Close
right breast pain; Shoulder pain; can't move shoulder/ can't move her arm/ her shoulder is immobile; Shortness of breath; Anxiety; breast is hard; shoulder pain was going down her back to the trapezius/ all the way to the back; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse, the patient. This 64-year-old female patient reported for herself that she received the second dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Batch/lot number: ER8731) via an unspecified route in the left arm on 18Apr2021 at 12:15 (at the age of 64-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included tick bite, blood pressure, nerve pain, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), and sciatica. The patient had no family history. The patient had no other prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks) of the COVID vaccine. Ongoing concomitant medications included olmesartan for blood pressure, duloxetine for nerve pain, omeprazole for GERD, famotidine for GERD; all taken for years, meloxicam for sciatica taken for 2 months and ongoing and doxycycline from 16Apr2021 and ongoing for tick bite (reported that she kept forgetting to take it). The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Lot Number: ER8727) on 28Mar2021 at 12:00 in the left arm as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. That dose went in the deltoid and she had no issues. Then she received the second dose on 18Apr2021 at 12:15 in the left arm. She believes it was administered in the soft tissue behind the deltoid. She noticed the person who gave the injection went behind the muscle toward the back of the arm. The next day after the second dose, she felt fine. Then the second morning it felt as if her shoulder was dislocated; and her breast is hard and painful; and she can't breath. She called her doctor who said that was not a common side effect but she stated she knows it is a side effect. The doctor recommended she go to the ER but patient didn't want to go. She stated that she doesn't know if missing the muscle is going to let the medication absorb or if it has penetrated the soft tissue. The clinical course of events was further described as follows: On 20Apr2021 at 08:00, the second morning, she woke up and felt severe pain in her right breast and shoulder all the way to back; adds she can't move her arm and her breast is so painful she can't touch it and her shoulder is immobile. She is also having very bad shortness of breath, adds she thought that may be from anxiety; so later in the day she took a alprazolam (XANAX). She added that she put up with the pain all morning and thought maybe she was working herself up so she took one half of a Xanax to calm down, to see if it was just anxiety but the shortness of breath and pain were still there. She reported she was continuing to feel all of these effects at the same level. She doesn't want to go to the ER because of the expense. The shoulder pain was going down her back to the trapezius. She clarified that she can move her shoulder and her arm, but the pain was so breathtaking that she doesn't move it and she has her arm in a sling. There were no relevant tests performed. The clinical outcome of the events right breast pain, breast is hard, shoulder pain, shoulder pain going down her back, shortness of breath, can't move shoulder/arm/ shoulder is immobile, and anxiety was not recovered. The patient mentioned that she doesn't know if not getting the shot in the deltoid caused her symptoms or not.; Sender's Comments: Based on chronological connection to the vaccine a causal relationship between reported events and BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE) cannot be completely excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

This 64-year-old female patient received the 1st dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: Er8730) via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 02Apr2021 15: 15 as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included allergy induced asthma and hypothyroid. Concomitant medications included levothyroxine, simvastatin, omeprazole. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient experienced 4 weeks of intermittent fevers (up to 103.1), chills and inflamed asthma symptoms including bronchitis and brain fog. Then, week 5 just as the patient was beginning to feel better, vertigo. All stated on 03Apr2021 21:00. Treatment was received for the adverse event with steroids, antibiotics. The events result in: doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit and Emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient underwent covid test post-vaccination on 27Apr2021 And on 12Apr2021, both via nasal swab and with negative results. Outcome of the events was not recovered. allergic reaction; Lungs itchy and inflamed; Throat itchy; felt like fiberglass in her throat; coughing and was numb all over; numbness on her left side/numb all over; asthma; walking crooked; couldn't talk right, her speech was slurred; Her oxygen levels had dropped at work; Legs like spaghetti; Her arm was so sore the first time; This is spontaneous report from contactable consumer (patient). A 64-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 19Mar2021 (Lot Number: EN6207, at age of 64-year-old) as single dose for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included cancer, autoimmune disorder, rheumatoid arthritis, fibromyalgia, multiple sclerosis and Bechet's. Concomitant medication was not reported. She felt she had an allergic reaction after the first dose on 19Mar2021. She clarified that her throat felt really itchy, and her lungs started feeling itchy and inflamed, she started coughing and getting asthma. Throat itchy was started 19Mar2021. They made her stay for 15 minutes after. She was sitting there and felt it coming on and took 2 Benadryl, coffee and inhaler. But she told the people there she had to get her inhaler from her car. They helped to walk her out to get it, but it was empty too. It felt like fiberglass in her throat. It lasted 3 weeks and then it returned after the second dose and got worse because of the second vaccine. She always had a tiny itch in her throat because of her allergies and it was there all the time. She had been on Gerson Therapy for 2 weeks, and it cured her cancer when she was on it. Lungs itchy and inflamed was started on 19Mar2021. She didn't have her inhaler in the car and when she arrived home she got the one by her bed and it was empty. She had to go to work and she drank 2 more cups of coffee and went to work. She started feeling worse. Her breathing was no better, she had more coughing and was numb all over. She called her Daughter to go to the Emergency Room, but she went to the Urgent Care. She knows it was not the same, but it was closest. It was a Friday and there was no doctor there. This lasted until she received her new inhaler prescription. It took 4 days for her to feel better when she was like this. This episode took a week for her to feel better. She didn't feel good for 3 weeks. She didn't go to the Emergency Room. She was getting back to normal with this by the time she got her 2nd shot. Her friend let her borrow an inhaler at work. The Doctor told her that she took too much Benadryl, but she took 3 in 8 hours, but the doctor said it was too much. Coughing, barking asthma cough: started 19Mar2021 and lasted until she got the inhaler. It helped, but it took a couple days to get back to normal. By the time she arrived at Urgent Care she was walking crooked, couldn't talk right, her speech was slurred. Her oxygen levels had dropped at work. It started on 19Mar2021. She took 2 puffs of her friends inhaler, and her Oxygen level went up on the way to Urgent Care. By the time she got to urgent care her oxygen levels were in the low 90's instead of in the 80's. Caller said that her oxygen levels were like 94, but her muscles were still not responding very good. When it was below 85, her left side goes numb and she couldn't use her left arm and her legs get like spaghetti and she felt like the scarecrow in Wizard of Oz. Her Oxygen was 94 and was much better. Her muscles were not responding at the time and the Doctor didn't allow her to drive herself to Walmart to get her prescription. Crooked walk was from 19Mar2021. It got better after she got her prescription and used the inhaler. Usually taking 1 Benadryl and using the inhaler every 4 hours for a few days she gets better. She uses it once and it only takes 20 -30 minutes to feel better again. Legs like spaghetti was started on 19Mar2021. She still had an itchy throat and light cough in her lungs for quite a while, but it was not life threatening. The numbness on her left side, that occurred 1st, and her right arm only functions. She can use her phone. Caller asking why it goes wacko? It ended on 19Mar2021 and she recovered completely. Her arm was so sore the first time. It was difficult to get in and out of car for 3 weeks, but she recovered completely. She helps the handicap people, so she had it put in her left hip. It was sore for about 2 weeks, but she recovered completely. The outcome of the events "Legs like spaghetti" and "Her arm was so sore the first time" was recovered on an unspecified date on 2021, for other events was unknown.

That caused a severe headache that started on the 3rd day and lasted 4 days. It was really bad on the 1st day and she wanted to go to the Emergency Room. She usually put Ibuprofen in her Benadryl bottle for her inflammation. That was the only thing that she took. She took Turmeric and fish oil and several other supplements. Her headache peaked on the 4th day, and she took the Ibuprofen and was better the next day. Throat swelling started on the 5th day and lasted and was still causing her difficulty pronouncing words. She experienced a personality change and she wouldn't have the vaccine again. She couldn't remember where she put things, started on the 7th day after her second dose and lasted until the Therapy made her feel better. Finally, after 4 weeks, she recovered completely and was pretty much back normal now. Caller added she was a happy person and was with her Cancer. People asked how she did it. But with this experience she literally wanted to hurt someone or kill herself, and no it was not normal. She was so cranky. She was sure it was the swelling in her brain. With her food allergies she got swelling, intense depression, suicidal tendencies, and a fight or flight response. She wanted to leave her life, it was scary. Recently diagnosed with it, she has been sitting around because of Covid.), anxiety from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. Family Medical History was none. Concomitant medications included ongoing lorazepam (LORAZEPAM A) at 0.5mg as needed for anxiety for a couple of years, about 3 or 4 years; ongoing metformin hydrochloride (METFORMIN [METFORMIN HYDROCHLORIDE]) at 500 mg, 2x/day (500mg twice a day) for diabetes mellitus for a couple of months (She started this medication 2 months before the covid vaccine); cannabidiol (CBD OIL) takes as needed. The patient experienced mrsa (staphylococcal infection) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , bronchitis on 16Mar2021 with outcome of unknown, fever on 14Mar2021 with outcome of recovered , swelling and pain under breasts, under armpits and in lymph nodes on 15Mar2021 with outcome of unknown, swelling and pain under breasts, under armpits and in lymph nodes on 15Mar2021 with outcome of unknown, swelling and pain under breasts, under armpits and in lymph nodes on 15Mar2021 with outcome of unknown, swelling and pain under breasts, under armpits and in lymph nodes on 15Mar2021 with outcome of unknown, swelling and pain under breasts, under armpits and in lymph nodes on 15Mar2021 with outcome of unknown, rash up and down and all over her arms on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown, couldn't breathe when laying down on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , tiredness on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown, heart rate high on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown, she felt hot and cold all day on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown, breasts were tender on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown, she couldn't sleep on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown, she doesn't feel like herself. she is scared on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown, had the vaccine 9 mar 2021/she is 65 and is afraid to get the second shot but is also afraid to not get the second shot on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included echocardiogram normal: normal on unknown date. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of bronchitis , heart rate high. The clinical course was reported as follows: Caller received the first dose of the Pfizer COVID vaccine on 09 MAR 2021. Caller states the past couple of months she has experienced a lot of adverse events. Caller states she has had issues with bronchitis and went to a pulmonologists and cardiologists and she has been put on 27 different medications. Caller states after all of these things going on she is not sure if she should receive the second dose. Caller states one doctor told her she should not receive the second dose and one doctor told her she should. Caller would like to know if she should receive the second dose of the Pfizer COVID vaccine. Caller states her doctor doesn't want to tell her what to do because she thinks he is afraid that she might sue him. Caller thought that by calling Pfizer she would get some advice but she is getting nowhere. Caller would like to know if she can receive the Johnson and Johnson Covid vaccine as her second dose instead of receiving the Pfizer COVID vaccine? Had the vaccine 9Mar2021 and is just recovering now. Last week, she was finally feeling like herself. She had some medical conditions that put her at risk. She is 65 and is afraid to get the second shot but is also afraid to not get the second shot. Her doctor thinks it is too coincidental that this happened right after the vaccine. Has been talking to a lot of doctors. Is afraid to get the second vaccination. So now, she is just trying to figure it out. It really knocked her out, she has had 27 medications, she's been to the ER 3 times, been to the doctor 7 times, it just really knocked her out, they first thought it was a heart condition, then a lung condition. Has been having rashes and all kinds of stuff. Is afraid to not get the second dose. One of her doctors recommended the Johnson & Johnson, but is that safe, no. Weight was about 200 pounds. Started 5 days after the vaccine. Fever: On Sunday, started to get a fever. It was on and off all day. She thought it was a normal reaction and didn't think much of it. It was weird. It would be like 20 minutes and then fine, and would be off an on all day. It was a low grade fever, never more than 100. she felt hot and cold all day. It was most of Sunday and stopped in the evening. Treatment: none. Swelling and pain under breasts, under armpits and in lymph nodes: Started Monday. Breasts were tender as well as if like she was having a period. There was pain underneath her arm and in the lymph nodes. Lasted for 2 days. Treatment was none. Felt like bronchitis: On Tuesday, it started to get what she thought was bronchitis. She has a propensity to get bronchitis. She hasn't gotten sick in 2 years. She immediately went to the doctor. This went on for 2 months. Treatment: They prescribed Prednisone, nebulizers and antibiotics which she finished everything 3 weeks ago. She couldn't sleep and had to sleep sitting up, she couldn't lay down, it started right away when she felt she had the bronchitis. Rash up and down and all over her arms: She then developed a reaction and had a rash up and down her arms, all over her arms. Felt the bronchitis symptoms right away. It was the weirdest thing and she couldn't lay down. Every time she would get up, she couldn't breathe. Went to the emergency room 3 times but was not admitted. At one point, she had a rash all over her body. Her doctor thought it was MRSA. This happened a month into all of this. She got the vaccine 8 or 9 Mar 2021. This rash occurred some time in mid April. When it started, the rash was everywhere in her body. It was so severe, that they thought it was MRSA. Gave her another bout of antibiotics. She had sores that were opening all over her body. She then went to the Emergency room and they treated her there. The other time she went to the emergency room because she couldn't breathe. She had to sit in a Lazy boy chair for 2 months. The pulmonologist and the heart doctor couldn't find anything. When they though it was bronchitis, they treated her for 2 months with Prednisone. She got Candida's from the Prednisone. They put her on 27 medications total. The pulmonologist said it was not the lungs, it was the heart. She was put on medication to slow down the heart rate. It had been running about 119. The medication she was put on was Metoprolol Tartrate 25mg. It slows down the heart rate, it has been so high. She was put on the medication 23 Apr 2021. It went so high. Her oxygen has been good. Her heart rate was never slowing down. She is still taking the Metoprolol, her rate is running like 118 and 108, it never slows down. The pulmonologist said it was not the lungs, its the heart and she is going to see him tomorrow for a follow up echo. She is so sick from so many medicines. Is still experiencing a lot of tiredness. It is the weirdest and is very strange. When she was laying down and couldn't breathe, the doctor said they felt like she was going into heart failure. The Echo didn't find anything wrong. It was a weird thing. She talked to both of the doctors, the pulmonologist and the family doctor who said that it was too coincidental that it was from the Pfizer. The Echo was a week and a half ago. The family doctor read it sand it looked normal. The pulmonologist who ordered the test is going to check it tomorrow. Her family doctor said to not get the second shot. The other doctor said she could probably take it. She doesn't feel like herself. She is scared. No history of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect. No additional Vaccines Administered on Same Date of the Pfizer Suspect. Event bronchitis like symptoms required a visit to Emergency Room for 3 times and Physician Office and has been to the family doctor at least 5 times. No prior Vaccinations (within 4 weeks) but had the flu shot in the fall. AE following prior vaccinations was none. Relevant Tests was none or Unknown. Caller states that she is overweight. Caller states that she is trying to get out of here to go to a doctors appointment. Caller states that she has the bottle, she will ask her spouse to read it since she can see better, the product is Metoprolol Tartrate 25mg. Patient did not had AE(s) following prior vaccinations. In Mar 2021, The patient experienced breathing difficulty and felt that her heart was pumping in her chest and this was making it hard for her to walk and the next week chest pain under left breast, a couple of days after first vaccine around 11Mar2021 or 12Mar2021 as the chest pain would start again when she was walking and she occasionally feels a twinge, reclarified, and she had to go to the emergency room and get evaluated. Patient went to the emergency room had an EKG and a troponin blood test, which were all negative on 29Apr2021. It was reported that as about 5-7 days after the shot, around the 10Mar2021 or 11Mar2021 in afternoon and it was isolated to the same day as it started. After she was in the emergency room and saw the cardiologist, and after the recent reports of the vaccine's effected with the heart, the cardiologist thought the vaccine caused effects. Patient had the second vaccine, and then reclarified, all of the symptoms went away. Patient received second dose of vaccine on 26Mar2021 around noon (Lot: ER8730, expiration: unknown) via unspecified route of administration in right arm. After second vaccine patient had a fever, of 102 degrees and felt exhausted for two days, after the second vaccine on 26Mar2021, Enlarged spleen on 29Apr2021. Fever lasted about a day and a half later. Feeling exhausted lasted for about a week. Facility was hospital, off site location. It was reported that patient also saw a liver specialist, and that doctor, wanted her effects, to be reported. Because all of the heart tests were negative, the liver specialist ordered an MRI elastograph of the liver and spleen and that test showed she had an enlarged spleen. Follow up attempts are needed. Further information has been requested.

She would feel more comfortable doing that. my lower extremities went cold for an instant when they gave the vaccine but it quickly passed. Wait half an hour of post vaccination observation and it went well. On the return car the feeling of cold returned to me in my arms and legs. I used the oximeter and I saw that my heart rate was at 110 and kept going up and the oxygen was going down. I called 911 when the blood pressure monitor and oximeter reached the limit and started flashing, oxygen at 92 and pulses at 141. I thought I was dying. The 911 operator told me to lie down and wait for the paramedics and she stayed with me on the line. I also put ice on my chest. When they arrived my signs began to normalize. I can't quite remember what happened next that day.

Heart palpitations 45 minutes after shot , only lasted a few minutes, shortness or breath at random times . First time 1&1/2 hours after injection without any asthma triggers, then 4-5 times lasted a few minutes each time during first 24 hrs, coughed more frequently, only used my rescue inhaler 3x during the first 48 hrs, fine rash on my face the next morning, lasted 48 hrs. I had body aches, chills , didn?t feel well for first 48 hours after the shot, ok now, just still tender at injection site, that is improving. Concerned I may have had a mild allergic reaction, worried about getting 2nd dose, but my doctor told me to take Benadryl prior to second dose & have someone drive me to the appointment, and get the second dose.

Close
About 15 minutes after receiving Pfizer vaccine dose 1 IM LD, pt experienced itchiness and tightness of the throat and breathing difficulty. Pt immediately brought to nearby cots to lay down. BP 130/78, Pulse 92, O2 99. 5 minutes later BP increased to 142/86, Pulse 70, O2 99. Pt began to relax a bit but symptoms were unchanged and Epinephrine 0.3mg x1 given & EMS called. BP 10 minutes later 144/80, pulse 70 O2 99. EMS arrived 10 minutes later, BP 146/90, and brought to nearby hospital.

Close
severe ringing in ears; Lump feeling in throat/something was in her throat; throat swelling; Anxiety; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 65-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection), via an unspecified route of administration on left arm on 16Jan2021 11:30 at a single dose as the patient is a counselor, essential worker, in the health field but she got in because of age (COVID-19 immunization). Medical history included Subclinical hypothyroid (she takes no meds. Was diagnosed 10 years ago), allergies to Sulfa drug, seasonal allergies and sprained wrist. A couple antibiotics bother her stomach but she was not allergic. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. Concomitant medications included estradiol, B12, calcium and glucosamine. Other medications included estrogen, vitamins, glucosamine supplements, and takes a cream for injury: sprained wrist, she doesn't know the name of it, it is an anti-inflammatory cream, she doesn't think any of that will do anything. No other vaccine in four weeks. The patient had the vaccine on 16Jan2021 Saturday and within 15 minutes (also reported as 20 minutes after shot and at 12:00), the patient experienced severe ringing in ears. She had severe ringing in her ears, it was really loud, and was still there. She can't seem to figure out if it was normal, what's causing it and could it be from the vaccine. It may have been anxiety because of that, but right after she heard ringing, there was a lump feeling in her throat on same day, like something was in her throat, she thought she had throat swelling, it lasted a couple of days, but she had no shortness of breath or anything. Ringing in ears was a lot worse in the morning, and gets better during the day, maybe because she was around noise, but it comes and goes, there are two separate sounds, one was a high pitched and continuous, the other one was lower pitched, a little fragmented, if she drew a picture, there would be little dust particles in the air, but the other is constant, she tried really hard to ignore, but it was driving her nuts. She is hoping it will go away. The lump feeling in her throat was gone, she was wondering if it was anxiety. It was mentioned, "She gets nervous, gets a lump in her throat a lot", but this was really severe, but she saw a man being taken away in an ambulance, and that scared her, she was waiting in the waiting area, and saw that, so it scared her. Recovered completely from the lump feeling in her throat. Throat was normal in 2 days but ears ringing still there after 4 days. There was no treatment for the events severe ringing in ears and Lump feeling in throat. The outcome of the events severe ringing in ears was not recovered; event Lump feeling in throat and throat swelling was recovered in 18Jan2021; and unknown outcome for the other event. Information on lot/batch number has been requested.

65 2021-02-18 shortness of breath 1 PM I received the vaccine and withing 5 minutes had a slight pain on the left side of my head whic... Read more
Close
1 PM I received the vaccine and withing 5 minutes had a slight pain on the left side of my head which then continued to a pain in my neck. also left side, then back pain, then slightly short of breath. I remained in the waiting area for over a half hour and felt no worse, but did report it to the young woman at the exit who said that was odd and seemed the kind of response with the second dose. I presumed it might be due to my already having antibodies. As I continued my day those symptoms quickly dispersed and I felt fine, albeit with a light soreness at the site on my left arm. At approximately 6pm I felt very fatigued and rested until 10pm, when I began to have chills, a headache and nausea. My left arm was also so sore I could not lay comfortably. I took Tylenol and aspirin both at 11:30 pm and attempted to sleep, which was fitful and disturbing. I had strange neurological events, such as odd visions in my half sleep and bizarre semi dreams but could not waken. At 4:00 AM I finally was able to pull out of this state and the last thing in my mind was a conversation with someone trying to explain what was happening to me, in my mind not vocal, that was in Italian. That is my second language. All day I had unwanted words, ideas etc. floating about in my brain. I could no longer sleep and was very weak, had terrible head and body aches and my legs also ached terribly. I was also slightly nauseous.These were all symptoms, minus the disturbing neurological one, that I had with Covid. I was too weak to leave the bed until much later in the day. I am still having effects but much less and I am at the 72 hour mark. I remained at rest all day and ran a low fever, then again a fever

anaphylactic reaction; having issues breathing/didn't have normal respiratory support; swallowing, weakness, unable to take anything by mouth/had lost ability to swallow; swallowing, weakness, unable to take anything by mouth; affected my lungs, gut, muscles, everything.; still having lung issues; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer(patient). A 65-year-old female patient received first dose BNT162B2 (Pfizer BioNTech Covid 19 vaccine, lot number RM9809), via an unspecified route of administration on 03Feb2021 at the 65 years old at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The medical history included Muscular dystrophy. The concomitant medications included unspecified multiple medications. The patient received the first dose on 03Feb2021. Immediately after the vaccine on 03Feb2021 she had an anaphylactic reaction, received an Epipen, went to the ER was given steroids and sent home. Next day, still having symptoms, received second Epipen administration, went to Urgent Care, was admitted to hospital 04Feb2021. The patient stated she had a history of muscular dystrophy. She stated she was having issues breathing, swallowing, weakness, unable to take anything by mouth, didn't have normal respiratory support in Feb2021. It had affected her lungs, gut, muscles, everything. She may leave here on hospice. She wanted to know if there were others who had reported side effects such as hers. She had anaphylactic reaction to the mineral. She was still in the hospital. She had lost ability to swallow and she was still having lung issues in Feb2021. She was a disabled rehab healthcare worker. She did not have an address right now in the hospital but if sent her something later once she get out she will be able to do that but she did not have it now. She takes multiple medications. Right now she cannot take medications she need orally. She had gone to hospital getting meds via primarily IV. She had acute anaphylactic reaction immediately after the vaccine and went by ambulance to hospital and was given steroids, care basically and sent home and she still had issues the next day and it kept going from home to urgent care to admission at the hospital. She had done lot of lab tests in Feb2021. She was very concerned that this was not going to be a temporary issue. She had form of muscular dystrophy and now what was happening was the week before she got the vaccine totally independent in her home, feeling ok, medications okay and now she was at IV medications not being able to swallow. She talked to someone yesterday and they told she should be calling and reporting what happened and that was why she had been on the phone all day. She just want make sure she did not feel like the healthcare was reaching out to their own vaccination department and she want to make absolutely sure that not only does Pfizer know that have a horrid reaction but she want the healthcare firm that she had a horrid reaction and she want the CDC to know that she had a horrid reaction because right now she would tell all her friends with the severe form of muscle dystrophy she had not going to be vaccinated even though the researchers were telling her to get vaccinated. It was going to take a while to stop the efficacy again and having to be on the phone everyday when she was barely breathing. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures, which included Lab test unknown result in Feb2021. The outcome of the events was unknown.

Notable PMHx: CHF, morbid obesity, diabetes, Patient is 3 weeks out from hospitalization for COVID-19 pneumonia. She has been more confused over the couple of days before admission. Creatinine was near her baseline at 1.8. She did have elevated alkaline phosphatase at 452. White count was elevated at 14.7. Patient was difficult to arouse in the ER. On my exam, patient is difficult to arouse. After shaking her shoulder and yelling at her, she did open her eyes and say to me "I'm ok" before closing her eyes again. She is satting well on nasal canula oxygen.

Close
Progress Notes Expand AllCollapse All COVID VACCINE CLINIC 3/3/2021 Subjective Pt. is a 65 y.o. female who was seen at COVID Vaccine Clinic today for her first dose of the COVID 19 vaccination. She was given the Pfizer vaccination in the left deltoid muscle. During her 30 minute waiting period after the injection, the patient began to experience throat tightness. She denied rash, hives, welts, difficulty breathing, difficulty swallowing, wheezing, hoarseness, stridor, itching, lightheadedness, dizziness, facial swelling, lip swelling and tongue swelling. This provider was notified of patient reaction and she was then assessed in the emergency bay area. Monitored patient for severe reaction symptoms, including but not limited to blood pressure abnormality , hypotension, rapid progression of symptoms, respiratory distress and tongue swelling. Past Medical History: Diagnosis Date ? Belching ? Bloating ? Chicken pox ? Cold sensation of skin ? Diarrhea ? Ear pain ? Generalized headaches ? German measles ? Graves disease ? Measles ? Mumps ? PVC (premature ventricular contraction) ? Sinusitis ? Thyrotoxicosis without mention of goiter or other cause, without mention of thyrotoxic crisis or storm Hyperthyroidism; ? Type II or unspecified type diabetes mellitus with unspecified complication, not stated as uncontrolled (HCC) DM Type II with comp; ? Unspecified essential hypertension Hypertension; ? Varicella without mention of complication Chicken Pox; ALLERGY REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Patient complains of sore throat, frequent throat clearing and headaches (states she was outside yesterday and developed a headache/sinus headache. She has not taken anything for it.) Patient denies chills, fever and malaise/fatigue Previous Reactions: hx of reaction to tetanus. Reaction was arm swelling and throat swelling per pt. She did not take any medications I.e. anti-histamines prior to coming. She has throat clearing, states this is chronic, unchanged. She reports that she isn't sure if this is allergic or anxiety. Objective Vitals Vitals: 03/03/21 0940 03/03/21 0945 BP: (!) 190/71 (!) 167/76 Pulse: 86 SpO2: 100% Physical Exam Vitals and nursing note reviewed. Constitutional: General: She is not in acute distress. Appearance: Normal appearance. She is well-developed. She is not diaphoretic. HENT: Mouth/Throat: Mouth: Mucous membranes are moist. Pharynx: Oropharynx is clear. Comments: Clear airway Eyes: General: Right eye: No discharge. Left eye: No discharge. Conjunctiva/sclera: Conjunctivae normal. Pupils: Pupils are equal, round, and reactive to light. Cardiovascular: Rate and Rhythm: Normal rate and regular rhythm. Pulses: Normal pulses. Heart sounds: Normal heart sounds. Pulmonary: Effort: Pulmonary effort is normal. No respiratory distress. Breath sounds: Normal breath sounds. No wheezing. Skin: General: Skin is warm and dry. Neurological: General: No focal deficit present. Mental Status: She is alert and oriented to person, place, and time. Gait: Gait normal. Psychiatric: Mood and Affect: Mood is anxious (slightly anxious). Behavior: Behavior normal. Thought Content: Thought content normal. Judgment: Judgment normal. Assessment/Plan Treatment included: antihistamines and water pepcid and zyrtec Follow up response to treatment: good. Patient discharge: Stable to go home and follow up with PCP. Differential Diagnosis: Vaccine-Related Anxiety (include misc mental health) and Systemic reaction (hypoglycemia, hypotension, generalized rash). HTN More likely anxiety related in her reaction today. No progression of her symptoms of throat tightness. She reports it is resolving. Time of observation was 30 minutes. She feels comfortable going home. She is aware of what to monitor for. IN regards to her elevated bp, pt states she was off her medications for a while and working on diet. She is stable w/o cp, sob, jaw pain, neuro deficits, lightheadedness, dizziness. Recommend she monitor her bp at home and if continues to be elevated >140/90 that she follow up with her pcp. She also is aware of hypertensive emergency and to go to ED if needed. She is stable and looks well on discharge. Pt is comfortable going home. She ambulated w/o difficulty and complaints. Pt also was offered tylenol here in the bay for her sinus headache that she developed yesterday after being outside. She declined. She reports she will take at home and resume her nasacort as usual. Electronically Signed 3/3/2021 9:50 AM 3 of 3

Within 30 minutes upper body muscles became very achy. Within next hour sinus tickle and nose running. Within two hours a tickling discomfort in lungs, coughing. (Left lung in particular.) Remembered then in early 2000's had pneumonia several times with scarring on left. Monday evening while trying to sleep much sneezing, nose blowing, fluids moving into chest and by morning a severe left calf cramp for which I had to stand up to relieve. Leg very sore until the 12th. Been very cold all week.
65 2021-03-13 throat tightness, throat swelling The minute I stood up after vaccine, I was very dizzy and my heart started pounding. Then I got naus... Read more
Close
The minute I stood up after vaccine, I was very dizzy and my heart started pounding. Then I got nausea. Was sent to Urgent Care office where I got EKG, which showed no problems with my heart. Went home, weak. Woke at 2:00 am with night sweats. When I got up I noticed swelling on face, throat, hands & feet. Faint pink rash ran up both fore arms and I had welts rising on my wrists. Nurse line I called said to to to ER asap, Took me a few hours to find a ride, my throat was closing up more by that point. I could tell over a few hours that my throat was swelling up. Went to nearest ER where I was very mentally confused. They gave me a shot of steroids and Benedryl. Later that night I got chills and was VERY weak. Had night sweats again. After a few days of rest, am still weak.

Client received 2nd dose Pfizer vaccine at Center. 4 hours later at approximately 1:20, client was shopping at store and started experiencing difficulty breathing, "throat closing." Client went to pharmacy with symptoms. pharmacist administered Benadryl at 1:22 pm and Epi-Pen at 1:23 pm. Ambulance called. Client stated she started feeling better after medication administered. 65 2021-03-16 acute respiratory failure Patient was noted to have abrupt respiratory failure 2 days after taking the 1st dose. The patient w... Read more
Close
Patient was noted to have abrupt respiratory failure 2 days after taking the 1st dose. The patient was admitted to the hospital for acute respiratory failure with hypoxemia secondary to acute CHF exacerbation. The patient had a transthoracic echocardiogram performed 2 weeks prior to hospitalization that was noted to show a left ventricular ejection fraction of 60-65%. At the hospitalization, her left ventricular ejection fraction was noted to decrease to 25-30%. Left heart catheterization was performed and showed no signs of ischemic heart disease (coronary artery disease). Patient was started on Entresto 24/26mg PO BID and Toprol XL 50mg PO daily and was diuresed with Bumex 1mg IV daily and was noted to have improvement in respiratory symptoms for which she was weaned off of BiPAP 15/5 with FiO2 of 50% down to room air. Patient had repeat transthoracic echocardiogram ordered prior to discharge and was noted to have an improvement in left ventricular ejection fraction to 48% prior to discharge. The only change was that the patient had the COVID-19 vaccination. Patient does not have any history of coronary artery disease or heart failure. Patient was worked up extensively for other etiologies of heart failure and none were found.

Close
Vaccine administered at 1145. At 1200 patient reported that her heart was racing, dizziness, lightheadedness, and throat feeling "tight." BP 110/70. Symptoms progressed. 911 Called. EpiPen administered in L thigh at 1210. 1211 BP 112/60, still complaining of "throat swelling" and lightheadedness. EMS arrived at 1213 and transported patient by ambulance to Hospital emergency department at 1217.
65 2021-03-16 throat tightness About an hour after receiving the vaccine patient experienced "tightness" in throat, no swelling pre... Read more
Close
About an hour after receiving the vaccine patient experienced "tightness" in throat, no swelling present. Two hours after receiving vaccine patient experienced a "prickly sensation" and broke out in red bumps on back, arms, wrists, stomach, legs, and behind knees. Bumps were red in color at itchy. Patient took a dose of diphenhydramine and that helped throat tightness, but did not relieve rash. Patient bathed in Dawn Dish soap, which helped to calm the itch temporarily. Rash has not completely gone away, as of 3/17/21 patient still suffers from itchy bumps on legs.
65 2021-03-17 wheezing, shortness of breath chest tightness, wheezing, sob, lightheaded. Evaluated by EMS-Refusal to transport.
65 2021-03-18 throat swelling, shortness of breath Seizures; throat swelled up; Troponin level increased; Mild heart attack; arm was hurting; breathing... Read more
Close
Seizures; throat swelled up; Troponin level increased; Mild heart attack; arm was hurting; breathing issues; Dry heaves; Mucus to come out; Nauseous; Dizzy; Headache; Ears became hypersensitive; Senses heightened; Throwed up; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other health professional (patient). A 65-year-old female patient received the 1st dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Manufacturer Pfizer-BioNTech), via an unspecified route of administration in arm left, on 27Feb2021 (lot# EN6205), as 0.3 ml single, for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included seizure from 2017 (she hasn't had a seizure in 8 months), allergy (to a lot of things). Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not have other vaccinations in 4 weeks prior. Within 15 minutes from having the vaccination at the center the patient experienced the first seizure that lasted about an hour. The seizure was really bad, she had breathing issues, dry heaving like she was trying to throw up, mucus to come out. The paramedics checked her out, they stayed around until she came out of the seizure. The patient went home and then at 07:50 PM she started heavy shallow breathing, was nauseous, dizzy, had a headache, which also happened at the center. Ears became hypersensitive, it was so noisy like loud, but her husband and the paramedics said it wasn't loud but she could hear it, all of her senses were heightened. She had a second seizure and didn't known how long it lasted. Patient had another seizure at 08:25 PM, at 08:40 PM she had another one, at 09:00 PM patient was coming back around and had another seizure and her throat closed up and that's when she went to the hospital, when her throat started to close up. While the patient was in the emergency room (ER) she had another seizure, she had 6 total seizures, she has never had this many before so she knows it was an adverse event to this vaccination. The seizures also increased the patient's heart enzymes- troponin levels. The patient has an EEG, was given 4 baby chewable Aspirin, as she had a mild heart attack. She thought the seizure increased her troponin. The patient mentioned that during the first event at the center, she was so into the seizures, she remembers grabbing her left shoulder, her arm was hurting. She was so into the seizure and trying to throwing up that it didn't dawn on her. The hospital didn't tell her she had a mild heart attack, it just dawned on her because her troponin levels were up mildly and she thought the seizures were triggering something in her heart, not just her seizures. The patient got another headache and was dizzy and had shallowing breathing. Seizures recovered on 28Feb2021. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included chest x-ray: normal, it didn't show pneumonia or fluid on the lungs on 27Feb2021, electrocardiogram (EKG): normal on unspecified date, electroencephalogram (EEG): normal on 27Feb2021, troponin: increased on 27Feb2021. Follow-up attempts are completed. No further information is expected.; Sender's Comments: A possible contributory effect of suspect BNT162B2 on reported events cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Day 3 post vaccine (3/10/21)began with tingling of lower lip and full sensation, red rash neck, upper chest,back and thighs. Seen by PCP and communicated with my rheumatologist . By next day upper lip felt tingly and full Dri increased my daily medrol to 8 mg .as throat felt tight . Noted next day mucoid eruptions on upper lips ,palate. Enlarged bilateral axillary lymph nodes. Rash dissipated by 3/14/21. Still have tight right throat feeling. Still on 6 mg medrol. Still have left shoulder and clavicular discomfort, intermittent tingling both hands and right leg, muscular weakness and fatigue.

Started with severe headache, moved to base of skull and neck. Next day (Thurs. 3/18) extreme pain in neck, chest and shoulder area, headache, chills, fatigue, shortness of breath, heart palpitations, brain fog, malaise. I thought it would pass. Friday I felt no better - by evening I felt swelling in my neck and chest area. Noticeable swelling in clavicle area on both sides. Saturday & Sunday I rode it out until I could see my Dr. on Monday March 22. Dr. gave me a shot of steroids and a script for MethylPREDNISolone - 21 tablets. Today is Tuesday, March 23, 2021 and I feel much, much better. Dr. said to NOT get the 2nd shot and to report this reaction.

Her arm is sore and swollen; Her arm is sore and swollen; dizziness; rapid heart rate/she started having a bounding rapid heart beat; SOB/Shortness of breath; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 65-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number EN6199 and expiration date not provided), via an unspecified route of administration first dose on 07Mar2021 at single dose for Covid-19 immunization. The patient's medical history included allergy history to a of number of medication and things (I'm prone to allergies). The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. On 07Mar2021, the patient received the first dose and she went to sit in the observation area for 5 minutes. The patient was not anxious at all about getting it but she started having a rapid heart rate/ bounding rapid heart beat and SOB/shortness of breath that lasted about a minute. The EMT checked her out and asked her to stay longer and she did and after about 5 more minutes the same thing happened again. These episodes lasted about 1 minute and she had dizziness with it. Also she did not have any further episodes and she stayed a long time. Her concern was whether this was indicative of an allergic reaction and should she still get the second dose. The patient was asking for information about 2nd dose being given after 42 days. The patient stated that she has not had any more of those symptoms at all. The patient arm was sore and swollen that was all now. The events heart rate increased, dyspnea, pain in extremity, and peripheral swelling was assessed by the reporter as serious (medically significant). The outcome of the events heart rate increased, dyspnea, and dizziness was recovered and unknown for the remaining events. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.

Close
On-set on dizziness, severe pain and swelling in left arm. 6 hour later, severe pain shooting up my arm, radiating up my neck to my left ear. Severe pain on left side of chest, left breast and pain radiating over shoulder to back on left side. On scale of 1-10, the pain was a 9. Extreme heaviness on both sides of chest. I could breath but seemed difficult to take deep breaths. Took an extra dose of my blood pressure meds and it eased the pain to a 4-5 and I was finally able to sleep at 1:00 AM. Starting on March 8, 2021 I began having severe night sweats and continue to have them at present (March 25, 2021). Dr does not recommend that I take the second vaccination due to my reaction to the first one. He did recommend that I take the Johnson & Johnson but the health department is stating that I have to complete my vaccinations with the same on I started with. I will not have the second Pfizer.

Started about 3am Saturday Morning March 6 with extreme pain between shoulder blades. Took 2 Advil and was able to go back to sleep. Woke in the morning feeling fine. Then started becoming ill early afternoon. Fever every day for 2 weeks. Nausea, vomiting, lose of appetite, extreme fatigue, headache, light sensitivity, rash, nagging slight cough and some nasal stuffiness mostly when talking (this might be because of the pollen) We were told it was an unidentified virus that would have to "run its course". 65 2021-03-30 shortness of breath, throat tightness Gasping for air; Tongue swelling; Swollen lips; Throat closing/restriction in her throat; tickle in ... Read more
Close
Gasping for air; Tongue swelling; Swollen lips; Throat closing/restriction in her throat; tickle in the throat; Headache; Dizzy; couldn't think clearly/her thinking wasn't clear; Confused; sensation in her chest; weak; fatigued; she had a full tongue which effecting her talking; tingling in her lips; anaphylactic reaction; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 65-year-old female patient received the 1st dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Lot Number: EN6198; Expiration Date: Jun2021), as single dose in left shoulder on 04Mar2021 at noon for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included Hashimoto's disease from May2012 and ongoing (autoimmune condition), ongoing undifferentiated connective tissue disease (UCTD) (autoimmune condition, unsure when diagnosed, started with polymyalgia rheumatica, then it went to rheumatoid arthritis (RA), then it went between Lupus and undifferentiated connective tissue disease), hospitalization: she had to go hospital twice in last 4 months, one was for Amlodipine which has polyethylene glycol and another time for Lisinopril as another blood pressure medication, she had 2 mild anaphylactic reactions in the last 4 months from amlodipine and Lisinopril, patient thought they all have PEG in the ingredients; underwent colonoscopy unknown results. There were no concomitant medications. On 04Mar2021 the patient experienced anaphylactic reaction, gasping for air, headache, dizzy, could not think clearly/her thinking was not clear, tongue swelling, swollen lips, throat closing/restriction in her throat, confused , sensation in her chest, weak, fatigued, she had a full tongue which effecting her talking, tickle in the throat, tingling in her lips. Course of events was as follows: The patient drove two hours to get the vaccine. The patient was vaccinated on 04Mar2021 at noon. The reaction started immediately, the caller had a severe headache within seconds, a little bit of sensation in her chest. The patient's thoughts were getting mixed up, she was not thinking clearly. This was one of first things that happened. The patient stumbled a little bit and the nurses were there around her and said she better sit down now. Then the sensation in her throat was starting to feel like it was closing up, her lips were swollen; so she would say she was a little bit confused. The patient started getting dizzy and her thinking was not clear, her tongue swelled, she had a full tongue which effecting her talking, she was gasping for air, she needed a moment to regulate her breathing. In regards to swollen lips she added at first she had a tickle in the throat, tingling in her lips, restriction in her throat, then she started slurring her words before the ambulance got there. On site they responded and watched her because she did not know if the symptoms were going to get worse. The paramedics gave the caller oxygen and an IV, since she had a mild experience she wanted to see what she did not take any medications before taking the vaccine so she could see what it would do, she did not take an ibuprofen or Tylenol. Patient commented, she knew it was not recommended, but some people do it. The patient mentioned started speaking very badly and very fast, she started gulping for air, and was informed the histamines are hitting her. She felt like she was going to faint, she thought if she was able to count back from ten she was going to be knocked out. Once she counted back she started to feel better. Like she would not faint. She did not faint often. She mentioned counting backwards from ten when getting a colonoscopy or something like don't get passed five and then knocked out, so she knows the sensation that can occur. After 1.5 hours they decided to call the emergency number and that was when the ambulance came. The ambulance service was the one who did everything for the patient. Because the patient got in the ambulance, they required her to go to the hospital, she was in a bed in the hall, by the time her doctor had looked at her, her throat had opened up and was feeling reasonably well after an hour an half. Confirmed she was not admitted just in the Emergency Room. On 04Mar202 the patient was at the hospital and was gasping for breath. The patient was on an IV and they gave her 125 mg of Solu-Medrol, 50 mg of Benadryl, and 5 mg of nausea medicine, phedrol the caller thought it was called. They did a good job and that helped the patient down from the most severe symptoms and she wanted to report her symptoms. The patient has been looking around and she thought this reaction it was from the polyethylene glycol. She mentioned historically she had a minor reaction. She had to go hospital twice in last four months. One was for Amlodipine which has polyethylene glycol and another time for Lisinopril which is another blood pressure medication. She confirmed she visited the emergency room for all 3 of these cases. The patient was still very confused on 09Mar2021 and over the weekend, she had to rest, she was weak and fatigued. On 09Mar2021 it was first real day she went back to work. She worked and asked her brother to watch out for her. On 10Mar2021 she was starting to feel a little bit better as regarded anaphylactic reaction, she has recovered with residual effects from the anaphylactic reaction. Confusion was improved but stull a concern. The outcome of anaphylactic reaction was recovered with sequelae, of headache, swollen lips, confused was recovering, of gasping for air, dizzy, could not think clearly/her thinking was not clear, tongue swelling, throat closing/restriction in her throat, sensation in her chest, weak, fatigued, she had a full tongue which effecting her talking, tickle in the throat, tingling in her lips was unknown. Patient asked if there was a conclusion about the PEG and her anaphylactic reaction. Her second dose was scheduled on 25Mar2021. Patient stated that her PCP and the CDC recommend to not get the second dose. Caller wanted to know if the anaphylaxis could be worse in the second dose. The patient wanted to know if she should she get the next dose. She was very concerned about COVID as well but did not know if it's worth her risking her life. Patient wanted to know if she can get the Johnson and Johnson vaccine after a certain amount of time after receiving the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine, caller cannot get the second dose of the Pfizer COVID vaccine due to a reaction. As of 12Mar2021 patent stated she does not wish to be contacted any further. A Product Complaint was filed.

anaphylactic; reactions are allergic; Terrible airway swelling, it felt like breathing through a straw, narrowing airway; Sensation of throat closure/narrowing of airway; significant shortness of breath/difficult to breath like through a straw; Pain in both lymph nodes, under both the armpit; Pain in both breasts; Dry cough; Itching, airway/trachea itchy; Hoarseness; Dizziness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 65-years-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, lot number: EL3248), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in the left deltoid on 15Feb2021 at 15:30 as a single dose for protection against Covid. Medical history included ongoing obesity as she gains and loses it, ongoing hypertension, ongoing asthma (at 59 she was bumped up to moderate degree asthma), ongoing significant food allergies, was born with and had ongoing eczema so she was allergic to milk (was given soy milk since she could not tolerate milk, when she drank milk, it produced phlegm/caused increase in mucus, ongoing significant environmental allergies wherein she would have allergies in the fall, from August through September and would have sneezing, congestion and itchy watery eyes. The patient also had a history of getting bronchitis but has not had it for a long time. The patient got stung by a bee when she was 40ish and her upper thigh got red, itchy and it lasted for 10 days and she and no other symptoms and was now careful around bees. The patient reacts to the smoky matches that blow out and make smoke, from the sulfa in the matches, fireplaces, wood burning and firepits. Concomitant medications included cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported; montelukast sodium (SINGULAIR) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported; fluticasone propionate, salmeterol xinafoate (ADVAIR) taken for asthma, start and stop date were not reported and fluticasone (manufacturer unknown) taken for asthma and allergies, start and stop date were not reported. The patient was on significant medications for her asthma, allergies and blood pressure. The patient previously got a flu shot at the end of Oct2020. The patient also previously took Aleve in her early 40's and was taking them for a neck injury for 2-3 months and at the end of the treatment she broke out in a rash. The patient also previously took aspirin 3 years ago and broke out in a rash. The patient also has an albuterol inhaler but has not taken it for years. The patient was careful, handwashing normally, wipes the shopping carts as they are germy. The patient stated that after receiving the vaccine, one main event was terrible airway swelling, itching and it was difficult to breathe. The terrible airway swelling felt like breathing through a straw and narrowing airway. She stated that it started 18.5 hours after the vaccine, on 16Feb2021 at 10 am and lasted for 4 hours between 10 to 2 pm. The patient also had itching wherein her airway and trachea were itchy which also started on 16Feb2021 at 10 am to 2 pm. The patient experienced narrowing of airway and sensation of throat closure also between 10 am to 2 pm. The patient also experienced that it was difficult to breathe but she did not feel like she needed to go to the hospital. If it got any worse she would gave went to the emergency department. She stated that she was sitting up, walking around and she would have had a significant shortness of breath and she was trying to wait it out. It was difficult to breath like through a straw which also started from 10 am to 2pm. She did not feel like she wanted to walk or do daily activities. She was on the phone with her mother and her mother could hear her difficulty in talking and her heavy breathing. The patient also experienced pain in both lymph nodes, under both armpits and pain in both breasts which started also on 16Feb2021 at 10 am and lasted for 24 hours the 10 am the next day. The patient had dizziness which started about noon and when she woke up the next day it as gone which she considered as medically significant since she is never dizzy and it was not due to her blood pressure and she has been on pills for a long time. The patient had dry cough and hoarseness also on 16Feb2021 from 10 am to 2 pm. The patient was afraid to take the second vaccine and she spoke to her pulmonologist who knows her history and was told that she would benefit. She thought that if she felt bad, she would go to the emergency room if it got worse but it did not. The patient stated that she thinks these reactions are allergic, the itching and narrowing of throat can be anaphylactic. The patient did not require any medical intervention and was not seen in the emergency department and was not hospitalized. The events lasted for 4 hours and stayed at that level. The patient did not get any treatment and it went away. The outcome of the events terrible airway swelling, it felt like breathing through a straw, narrowing airway, Dry cough, Itching, airway/trachea itchy, Hoarseness, Sensation of throat closure/narrowing of airway, reactions are allergic and anaphylactic was recovered on 16Feb2021 at 14:00. The outcome of dizziness was recovered on 17Feb2021 and the outcome of pain in both lymph nodes, under both the armpit and pain in both breasts on 17Feb2021 at 10:00. The patient reported that the events were considered as medically significant. The relatedness of the drug to the reactions from primary source reporter (method of assessment: Global Introspection) for the events was related.; Sender's Comments: A contributory role of vaccine BNT162B2 to reported events cannot be fully excluded since it is part of the product safety profile. Potential contributors include patient's advanced age, as well as underlying obesity, hypertension, asthma, eczema, multiple allergies and other co-morbidities. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Her symptoms started two days after she received the shot. She is supposed to get the second shot on Thursday 25Mar2021 and that's why she is calling to find out information on what other people reported as far as asthma patients. She is debating on getting the second shot. Initially caller states that for the most part, it cleared up and went away about three days ago, but then explains it is gradually getting better. Every once in a while, her throat feels dry and raw, but she drinks water and it feels better. At first, she did not want to really talk. She has asthma, the congestion never really goes away and it didn't really improve this time after prednisone like it usually does. She did not feel good on Friday, but on Saturday it got bad. Close
I had the 2nd vaccine on Thursday April 8th with no real adverse effects -- some fatigue . Went to the gym Monday evening 4/12 -- while running the track and doing some exercising I became seriously short of breath and this lasted the entire 1 hour workout depending on what I was doing. It took most of the night for the tightness and burning in my lungs to subside. I dont feel out of breath now, but it still isn't quite right. I did not have this issue after the 1st shot. I have to admit tho that I have a pulmonary exam scheduled for April 22 because of being a former smoker, etc. So, I dont know if the vaccine caused the problem or some underlying lung issue.

A 65-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot EP7534), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Left Arm on 23Mar2021 19:00 as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included ongoing laryngopharyngeal reflux diagnosed about 5 years ago, ongoing anxiety, usually happens during stressful circumstances; diagnosed about 20 years ago and she had had the sensation of labored breathing, dry mouth, and accelerated heart rate then yes for work like with public speaking; sensitive: Sulfa drugs, aesthetic filler in her face and allergic reaction Hyaluronic acid filler collagen and she doesn't smoke and drink. Family history included daughter was diagnosed with psychotic episode and diagnosed with mental illness and it was stressful getting that under control and she was sensitive to medication and surgical procedures she doesn't tolerate narcotics. Concomitant medication included clonazepam (KLONOPIN). She reported that she was prescribed .125 of clonazepam and it was a dissolvable sublingual and she doesn't use it frequently as she has read about reliance and potentially addictive and she will take a walk or watch a boring video to try to get her mind off it. The patient previously took oxycodone hydrochloride; oxycodone terephthalate; paracetamol (PERCOCET) and she was sensitive to Percocet; and darvocet and experienced sensitive to Darvocet post surgery; and codeine, and vicodin and was sensitive to both drugs, advil and causes her stomach to be upset, shingles vaccine, HPV vaccine, chicken pox vaccine and got 1 pox from that about 15 years ago when it first came out. The only post-surgical medicine pain reliever she can take was Tramadol and more often than not she doesn't have to do anything beyond Tylenol extra strength. On 24Mar2021, 04:00, the patient experienced extreme chills, and anxiety accompanied with tight, shallow, and labored breathing. She had troubled breathing due to this. She mentioned that she went to the emergency room (ER) that morning. On 27Mar2021, the patient had emphysema and agitation. On 26Mar2021, early in the morning, she had the breathing issue that she mentioned first concurrent with agitation and anxiety like at same time with the extreme chills. The sensation of agitation was all combined together, it like hit out of the blue while she was getting ready to go to sleep. She stated that at 4am it hit her with a sudden bout of extreme chills and at the same time a sense of anxiety, it felt like she hit a wall and couldn't get a full breath. She stays up late but wasn't doing anything anxiety provoking, she thought she was reading recipes. She sat to calm herself as she was not sure if it was a reaction or anxiety at the initial reaction fueling it further so she tried to sort of lower everything in her system and was concerned it could accelerate and not subside. At the hospital, they took her in an exam room and did her vitals and she was there about 2-3 hours and it was early in the morning and at that point sometime they took a chest x-ray, EKG, and blood work and at that point prior to that while she was waiting she was feeling a little better, the worst had subsided and she suggested she go and they asked her to stay since she was already checked in and to be seen. The doctor looked at the results and read the film and questioned about emphysema and she felt that was unrealistic reading as she doesn't smoke, doesn't drink and it's not in her genetic make up. The doctor told her lungs were showing a lot of air and she said maybe it was because she was gasping and they told her to take a big gulp of a breath and hold it to get the X-ray. The doctor suggested she see a pulmonologist and she didn't feel that was warranted. She contacted her general practitioner and they recommended she get the 2nd shot and had her see an allergist who also suggested she get the 2nd shot. The patient stated that she was not really overweight and doesn't drink and doesn't smoke and the allergist didn't mention but she saw in the paperwork that a side effect could be difficulty breathing. She had no swelling, body rash, dizziness or weakness. Since that episode, she periodically throughout the day, and she can't tell if it's anxiety or allergies or something but she felt labored breathing and tightness in her chest and can't get a full intake of breath. She reported that when she sleeps on her back the sensation disappears completely and when she sleeps on her side it reappears a little; 1-2 nights after, it woke her from sleep and she doesn't think she was dreaming about anxiety. She stated that she has never had anaphylactic if this should escalate what to do and she decided to go to the ER and they had her wait an additional 2 hours for a follow-up reading that was all clear, all fine, except emphysema thing which was again, she was just researching and forgot the medical term, she this it was hype aeration, too much air sucked in. Her general practitioner recommended she see an allergist for a 2nd opinion and was surprised she was up on anything and didn't mention side effect and the handout said it could be a possible side effect. She has to yawn a lotto get the air in. She does have laryngopharyngeal reflux prior and she clears her throat which is probably annoying and controls that through diet instead of taking Pepcid AC. She has had to clear her throat a lot but never had labored breathing or shortness of breath, that to get a full breath sometimes she has to yawn to get past that tightness of shallow breathing or labored breathing. On certain days she doesn't feel it and thinks it was done and she will have a spate and it happens and she thought there was something stressing and does a reality check and again it's that time of year and when she was taking her walk and walked past a certain block she started to wheeze from the pollen on an unspecified date and she called her allergist to see about getting something. She had a mask and that helped a little. Her allergies were not exacerbating on 23Mar2021 or 26Mar2021 but started the last few days and she has a wheezing cough that had an extended sort of wheeze at the end of the cough. Before her cough for LPR it was annoying throat clearing. After the vaccine, she took that walk through that one specific spot on her route she got to coughing and thinking she needs to call and get something prescribed something if anything if she gets the second shot it will address any of the side issues if they were related to allergies so don't have to contend. It was every night where she sort of feels it and she sleeps through the night so if it was tension related it subsides and can't distinguish what is emotional and physical but she was sleeping through the night and it was an indication that it was improving. She reported that when she visited her son and after she returned he told her he was unaware he had strep and didn't know it, he was asymptomatic and she had a sore throat and went to urgent care and had an exam and didn't have strep and doesn't know what it was but she was feeling better by the weekend. She was supposed to go back and everything was shutting and she didn't go. Maybe she was exposed and just had a mild thing while she was there. She was tested for Covid on 26Mar2021 and her result was negative, but they did not do an antibody test. She wanted to know if difficulty breathing was a common reaction with the vaccine, and if the side effects would be lesser after the 2nd dose since she already had a severe reaction after the 1st dose and if she should still receive the 2nd dose of the vaccine. She was concerned the 2nd shot will be more pronounced than the 1st and she doesn't want to go through that and it be more severe. She has heard if you had that reaction you may have been exposed to Covid before and she may have been around people with Covid that had positives and she may have antibodies from an asymptomatic experience and it may do more harm than good and she should do the 2nd shot. She mentioned this to her allergist and was told if she has a similar symptoms to call and get a bronchodilator. She was onboard with that but wants to discuss it because she finds it hard to believe she was the only one that had difficulty breathing and was wondering what was the duration of this labored breathing. She was scheduled for the second dose 18Apr2021. Outcome of events sore throat was recovered on an unspecified date; and outcome of rest of events was unknown.

coughing up blood; Coughing; Nausea; Headache; extreme fatigue; acute pain on the left side, she thought she cracked her rib/ rib pain; acute pain on the left side, she thought she cracked her rib/ rib pain; didn't sleep at all; difficulty breathing; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 65-year-old female patient received her first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: ER8757) at the age of 65-year-old, via an unspecified route of administration on left arm on 31Mar2021 at 13:00 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were reported as none. There were no additional vaccines administered on the same date and no vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID-19 vaccine. The patient previously took aspirin and experienced allergy which was described as deadly. She never took medications since she found that out at 16-year-old. The patient received her first shot on 31Mar2021 at a pharmacy and mentioned that she was not sick at the time of vaccination, but she had a violent reaction to it. When she received it, she didn't feel anything. People said you will get a sore arm, but she got none of that. Then in the middle of the night on Friday (02Apr2021) probably around 3:00, she woke up with acute pain on the left side, it was rib pain, she thought she cracked her rib. On the same day, she also experienced difficulty breathing, and didn't sleep at all. On Saturday morning (03Apr2021), when she woke up, she had nausea, a headache, and extreme fatigue, but wondered if the extreme fatigue was because she did not sleep. The nausea and headache went away 8 hours later, on the same day. On Sunday (04Apr2021), she was coughing and coughed up blood. When she coughed, there was blood in the mucous. She mentioned that she still has acute pain, she could not get comfortable. Her sister passed away in January and she had a 5 pm train she was supposed to catch, she was responsible for the funeral. She was thinking that if she went to a hospital, they would keep her for 24 hours, she could maybe make it to the funeral but that was questionable. By Monday (05Apr2021), the acute pain was gone, she still had a cough, there was still blood in the mucous, she has occasionally blood in the mucous. The cough has not gone away but she was getting better every day. The difficulty breathing continued until about 08Apr2021 (as reported), but she still has some shortness of breath, but nowhere near as bad. She consulted her notes and said she was at 30% on 03Apr2021 and she felt today that she was at 80% and every day she was a little better and better. She has to sleep upright, she was afraid to sleep flat, she slept in her chair, last night for 2 nights she slept upright in her bed. She probably could lay down, but she was more comfortable upright. Because she was sleeping upright, she was not fatigued, she was not sleeping well but she didn't think that has anything to do with what was going on. The events did not result in emergency room or physician office visit. She is supposed to get her second dose on 21Apr2021but she did not want to get the second shot. She asked if she could wait and get the one shot from Johnson & Johnson. She didn't know where to go anymore. The outcome of the event "acute pain on the left side, she thought she cracked her rib/ rib pain" was recovered on 05Apr2021, recovered on 03Apr2021 for "nausea" and "headache", recovered on Apr2021 for "extreme fatigue", not recovered for "didn't sleep at all", and recovering for all other events.
