68 2021-04-27 asthma Asthma flare up; dry, hacky cough; pain and tightness in her chest; pain and tightness in her chest;... Read more
Close
Asthma flare up; dry, hacky cough; pain and tightness in her chest; pain and tightness in her chest; nausea feeling in her chest; She gets this laryngitis; has trouble talking; She wants to make sure its not going into like a viral pneumonia; Flu-like symptoms; fever; achy; fatigue; Sore arm; Headache; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable pharmacist (patient). A 68-year-old female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; solution for injection; Lot Number: CER230) via an unspecified route of administration on 24Mar2021 at 11:30 (at the age of 68-years-old) as a single dose in the right arm for COVID-19 immunisation. The medical history included flu and suspected COVID-19 both in Jan2020 to an unspecified date (she had a bad flu back in Jan2020, which could have been COVID because it was such a bad flu, over a year ago), ongoing asthma from an unspecified date (mild asthma) and chest nausea in Jan2020 to an unspecified date. The patient had no history of any adverse events following prior vaccinations. Medical history (including any illness at time of vaccination) was also reported as none. Family medical history relevant to the adverse event included an uncle that had asthma, but no one else had breathing issues. Concomitant medications included fluticasone propionate/salmeterol xinafoate (ADVAIR) and ipratropium bromide/salbutamol sulfate (DUONEB), both ongoing and taken for asthma on unspecified dates. Other products were also reported as "no". The patient did not receive any prior vaccinations within 4 weeks prior to the COVID-19 vaccine and did not receive any additional vaccines on the same date as the COVID-19 vaccine. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; solution for injection; Lot Number: 3N6202) via an unspecified route of administration on 24Feb2021 at 11:30 (at the age of 68-years-old) as a single dose in the left arm for COVID-19 immunisation. On 24Mar2021 the patient experienced sore arm and headache; on 25Mar2021 the patient experienced flu-like symptoms, fever, achy, fatigue; on 02Apr2021 the patient experienced asthma flare up, dry, hacky cough, pain and tightness in her chest, nausea feeling in her chest; on unspecified dates in Apr2021 the patient experienced she gets this laryngitis, has trouble talking and she wants to make sure its not going into like a viral pneumonia. The reporter classified the events headache and flu-like symptoms as non-serious. The patient called to report that she had an asthma flare up 10 days (as reported) after her second dose of COVID-19 vaccine on 24Mar2021. The patient stated that she did not get a flare up often, she had mild asthma. She usually got mild flare-ups since she did not have severe asthma. She stated it could be something else, but she had not had a flare-up like this since she had a bad flu back in Jan2020, which could have been COVID-19 because it was such a bad flu. That was over a year ago. She received her second vaccine on 24Mar2021, and the asthma flare up and hacking cough started on 02Apr2021. On the night of 24Mar2021, she started with a headache. She had the shot at 11 something and by that evening before she went to bed, she had a headache and a sore arm, but that was no big deal. Then on 25Mar2021, she started with flu like symptoms/fever. The headache persisted through that as well. At that point, she did not have tightness or the dry, hacky cough. By the middle of the day on 27Mar2021, her flu-like symptoms were gone. She would consider these to be "non-serious", it was what she expected, as it was seen from the paperwork of the vaccine. By 28Mar2021, all of her symptoms were gone prior to the flare-up. She had typical flu-like symptoms: fever, headache, achy, fatigue on the 2nd, 3rd, and into the 4th day but then they cleared up. By the evening of the 4th day, she started feeling fairly normal. She stated that they were mild flu symptoms. Her temperature was only 100 for about a day. She stated that that was expected. Then, she went into this flare-up about the 10th day after the vaccine. The first 3 or 4 days after the flare up began, the flare up was worsening. Then, she got it under a little bit of control, so she was not coughing all night and having to sit up as she was sleeping. Now, she was concerned about the pain and tightness in her chest and the hacky cough. She wanted to make sure it was not going into like a viral pneumonia or another thing. She did not know. She kept increasing her Advair use and was at the top of that. She was doing the duoneb which she did not usually have to do. She had not had to do that since Jan2020 when she had the 5-week flu, or it could have been COVID (they were calling it a hoax back then). She was using her duoneb 4 times a day and now she was using it to 2-3 times, but she was still getting chest tightness, hacky cough. It was kind of like nausea- it was hard to explain, it was kind of like a chest nausea, which she had also had back in Jan2020 when she had the bad flu. She also would get this laryngitis and had trouble talking. With her flare-up, her chest tightness/nausea feeling in the chest continued. Now, she was getting into laryngitis type of thing, but she could loosen that up with her duoneb but if she got to the point where she could not do that, she would definitely have to see someone right away. She clarified that when her chest got tight, the dry, hacky cough continued/increased. When she did the breathing treatment, it loosened it up for about 3-4 hours and some of the pain would go away in her chest. If she talked too much, she would begin to cough. She had had this flare up 3 times in her life, it was not very common. She was diagnosed with asthma in her 40s, and this was her 3rd time ever having anything like this. This was the first time she had experienced a flare up like this. She had had 3 episodes since she had had asthma in her 40's and all 3 bad episodes were about the same. All the episodes were related to illness, it did not just happen out of the blue. It happened with a viral respiratory thing or the flu. The adverse events did not require a visit to the emergency room or physician office. The patient stated that she would call her physician or the clinic "today or tomorrow". She had not been to a doctor since her asthma flared up. Her respiratory doctor/pulmonologist moved away, there was no respiratory doctor nearby right now. So, her general practitioner was following her because it was a mild case and she had mild asthma. If it was severe, her doctor would make her go to a specialist. Relevant tests were reported as no. The patient used to be followed with pulmonary function tests until her respiratory doctor moved away. The patient stated that she took care of her 94 year old mother several days a week and because of all of the variances coming out, she thought it was her civic duty to prevent it from spreading through the population and creating more variances which was why she received the vaccine. She stated her doses were scheduled a month apart because they expecting to get a shipment of Moderna and they did not. They had to run to Buffalo to get the Pfizer vaccine, but they left her doses scheduled a month apart because the appointments were so hard to get. Normally, it would be 3 weeks. Her card clearly said Pfizer and they told her Pfizer, and they told her the reason for it being scheduled at 4 weeks. The patient called to inquire whether asthma flare-ups had been seen in clinical trials. It was not a reported side effect from the paperwork she received. When she looked online, she could not really find anything. She was thinking of going to a clinic but was wondering if there were any reports of flare-ups with asthma with the vaccine. With regards to causality, the patient stated it was a concern because she usually did not get a flare-up unless she was sick. She stated that there were many variables, and that it was spring, and bugs were out, but she did not usually get a flare-up like this. She stated that maybe it was a challenge to her immune system, the antibodies, but she did not know. She suspected the flare-up was related to the vaccine, but she did not have any idea. She would say yes, but she had no way of knowing. The flare-up usually only appeared if she got ill or something weird happened to her. The clinical outcomes of the events flu-like symptoms, fever, achy and fatigue were recovered/resolved on 27Mar2021; sore arm and headache were recovered/resolved on 28Mar2021; asthma flare up, dry, hacky cough, pain and tightness in her chest and nausea feeling in her chest were not recovered/not resolved; she gets this laryngitis, has trouble talking and she wants to make sure its not going into like a viral pneumonia were unknown. The reporter believed there was a reasonable possibility that the events sore arm, flu-like symptoms, asthma flare-up, dry, hacky cough, pain and tightness in her chest and nausea feeling in her chest were related to BNT162B2. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.; Sender's Comments: Based on the available information the events asthma flare-ups and viral pneumonia are attributed to intercurrent medical conditions, unlikely related to BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE). The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

today she is off kilter again; feels a heaviness in her eyes; all that coughing like something is irritating her lungs and she can't stop; it was making her lungs hypersensitive.; all of a sudden she got really really hot, she runs about 97-97.4 and she got so hot and her face got really red like she had a high fever and she was 99.2; burning in her stomach and a stomach ache; burning in her stomach and a stomach ache; never has that much energy when she was normal/had tons of energy; woke up on day 4 in the middle of the night and her lungs were pinching, pinching, pinching, like and asthma attack and she couldn't stop it and she had to get her old fashioned inhaler to stop it; tired; had weakness with climbing stairs and with exertion/ zapping her energy; 2 inches below the injection site the muscle was hard and swollen and sore; 2 inches below the injection site the muscle was hard and swollen and sore; 2 inches below the injection site the muscle was hard; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer (patient). A 68-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER- BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 07Apr2021 14:40 (lot number: EW0150) at age of 68 years as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included low vitamin D, lungs were working at 75% the capacity of an 84 year old and not 68 year old and asthma attacks. Concomitant medications included vitamin D2 and D3 and regular vitamins for low vitamin D, had been taking that for 6-7 weeks, tiotropium bromide (SPIRIVA RESPIMAT) 2.5mcg takes 2 inhales a day in the morning and salbutamol sulfate (PROAIR) 2 puffs and a special medication because her lungs were working at 75% the capacity of an 84 year old and not 68 year old and put her on an asthma medication to open her lungs. Patient got a flu shot every year and got it in Jan2021 and nothing. Patient stated that her symptoms were mild. Patient stated on day 1 after she got the shot she had nothing, that was 07Apr2021. Stated the next day (08Apr2021) she did not have injection site soreness but 2 inches below the injection site the muscle was hard and swollen and sore and remained that way for days 2, 3 and about day 4 it started to recede and day 7 it was tender. Stated it was one muscle and it was below the injection site, not at the injection site. Stated it was a lifting muscle, if she lifted her arm up it could only go so far and she would feel it and drop her arm down. Stated she got the injection in her left arm as she used it the least. Stated on days 2 (09Apr2021), 3 and 4 she had weakness with climbing stairs and with exertion, she could do it but she would notice it was more of a struggle. Stated that today she was off kilter again. Patient relayed that she looked all over online to see if she was sick with something. Stated she was tired on days 3 (10Apr2021) and 4 and that on days 5 (12Apr2021) and 6 she had tons of energy and she worked from dawn to dusk waxing floors and never has that much energy when she was normal. Stated that all of a sudden on day 5 and 6 she was perfect and then toward the evening of day 6 she thought it was her as she had to go to the Secretary of States and stand in line to renew her license and she did well and got home and started feeling tired. States she woke up last night of day 6 (13Apr2021) with a burning in her stomach and a stomach ache and it woke her and made her feel like she had food poisoning or something like that and nothing happened and she took 2 Tums and it kind of settled that down. Stated on day 7 (14Apr2021) she woke up and the stomach part was gone and all of a sudden she got really really hot, she runs about 97-97.4 and she got so hot and her face got really red like she had a high fever and she was 99.2, which is not much for most people but she feels and she took Motrin and after that she still feels a heaviness in her eyes and her temperature is 98.6 and she is normally in the 97's and was running a 2 degree fever and now maybe a 1 degree fever and she felt it in her eyes and didn't feel sick. Stated she felt fatigued like she want to take a nap but didn't feel ill. Stated whatever was going on was zapping her energy. Stated she woke up on day 4 (11Apr2021) in the middle of the night and her lungs were pinching, pinching, pinching, like an asthma attack and she couldn't stop it and she had to get her old fashioned inhaler to stop it. Stated this hadn't happened and she had been taking the special medication for 3 weeks now and it was very rare for her to get those attacks and this was worse than any. Patient relayed that today all day even with the special medication to open her lungs she can feel in her lungs that they were, she can't explain it, like they are gripping and releasing and gripping and releasing a little but. Stated she knew she was having some kind of asthma thing going on, it was not making her cough it was making her lungs hypersensitive. Stated she was expecting everything and she did read and nobody had symptoms that last more than 7 days and she was expecting them to be gone tomorrow, or she hopeed anyways. Stated the last 10 days had been easy-peasy and all of a sudden she was waking with all that coughing like something was irritating her lungs and she can't stop. Patient provided that it woke her husband up with her coughing for half an hour. States this lasted half an hour and was more than normal and something really irritated her lungs, shouldn't have happened as she is on the other thing every day and has not had an attack with that. Patient stated her provider didn't know as it was so relatively minor and was unusual but minor and she did not feel like it was life threatening. Stated her brother had Covid and she did not feel like she was trying to breathe and couldn't, or suffocating and dying. She did not feel that. The air irritated to even breathe and made her cough and couldn't stop and that was the first time she had to use an inhaler on top of on inhaler and something made her lungs respond to nothing there. Stated it may be her immune system thinking something was there, the headless thing in her lungs. Patient stated she thought she was over it and then got the fever not understanding if the fever was Covid related and she stayed at home and didn't go out until yesterday it was the 1st day out since Thursday and how could she have caught anything if she wasn't near anybody. Stated these were just thoughts in her head. Outcome of events was unknown.; Sender's Comments: The reported event of asthma aggravated was assessed as possibly related based on temporal association. The impact of this report on the benefit-risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for AE. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, ethics committees and investigators, as appropriate.
68 2021-05-02 chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, wheezing Patient was admitted due to COVID pneumonia without hypoxia. She has a history of COPD, hypertension... Read more
Close
Patient was admitted due to COVID pneumonia without hypoxia. She has a history of COPD, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, CAD, recent COVID-19 infection diagnosed on 04/16 presented to MMC ED for ongoing episodes of abdominal pain, nausea, diarrhea that has worsened for last couple of days. Patient has had symptoms of generalized fatigue malaise weakness is his since 4/14 and has had been worsened and was seen in ED on 4/21 were symptoms of some COPD exacerbation were for home with COVID-19 and was prescribed antibiotics and steroids which he took at home. Since then, patient has had symptoms of feeling more weakness, abdominal cramping pain radiating down his towards her groin with some burning in a.m. for urination and started noticing diarrhea, 3-4, loose, watery with yellowish output without any blood. Has some nausea but no vomiting, poor appetite and is trying to keep herself hydrated but unable to complete full drinks. Denies fever, and chills. No active cough, slight wheezing at home, but she has used her nebulizer 4 times and had improvements Patient did not qualify for any treatment but her home medications were continued. Patient did not have any shortness of breath, cough fever. Patient also had mild renal failure which resolved. Overall patient did well. Upon discharge examination, she denied any new complaints. Her renal failure resolved. She was recommended to stay 1 more day but she stated that she is feeling fine and want to be discharged. So patient discharged and told to return to emergency center if she gets any fever, increased diarrhea, nausea, vomiting.
68 2021-05-03 shortness of breath, very rapid breathing fever; fatigued; Did not have much energy/having no energy/low energy; Left Arm was painful and it g... Read more

fever; fatigued; Did not have much energy/having no energy/low energy; Left Arm was painful and it got swollen a bit; Left arm painful; Foggy and not clear; extreme shortness of breath/cannot catch her breath; almost hyperventilating/Hyperventilation; This is a spontaneous report from two contactable consumers (including husband and patient self) and patient self. A 68-year-old female patient received 1st dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number EN6204) at single dose on 20Mar2021 14:54 injected in left arm in the muscle for Covid-19 immunization. Medical history included shortness of breath, hypothyroidism and COVID-19 back in Dec2020. She had some food allergies that were diagnosed prior to getting the vaccine. Patient was tested positive for COVID on 21Dec2020 and negative on 20Jan2021. The symptoms followed for patient was a little coughing and no smell for 3 days and a little shortness of breath. Family medical history was none. Concomitant drug included levothyroxine 0.75 ug, once daily for hypothyroidism, which was taking for 15 years (as of 19Apr2021). No previous history of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect. No Prior Vaccinations (within 4 weeks). No additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer suspect. Patient experienced left arm painful on 20Mar2021 about an hour or two after she got the injection, did not have much energy on 21Mar2021 08:00, foggy and not clear from 21Mar2021 to 22Mar2021 08:00, shortness of breath started 24Mar2021 or 25Mar2021, and hyperventilation on an unknown date in Mar2021 (reported as a week or 9 days after receiving vaccine). The shortness of breath was what she referred to as hyperventilating. That came a week after the vaccine. The same date they took shot was when the arm pain started and the low energy was the day after. Foggy and not being clear was from 21Mar2021 to 22Mar2021. Shortness of breath started 24Mar2021 or 25Mar2021. In additional to shortness of breath, she had been hyperventilating. That began approximately a week or 9 days after receiving vaccine. Left arm was painful and it got swollen a bit and lasted for 48 hours. The husband experienced arm pain and said he almost had a fever and felt fatigued. The reporter thinks patient (his wife) felt the same. She had arm pain and not much energy. They came out of that ok. About a week after the first injection, she just cannot catch her breath. She started hyperventilating to the point where the husband thought she would expire. She also experienced being foggy and not clear and having no energy. First, she went to a Cardiologist and he said there was nothing wrong. She then saw a lung doctor who send for respiratory chest and did chest CT scans and everything was clear on both test. He did not prescribe any medications. A week after she saw him, she went to the ER on 31Mar2021for hyperventilation and shortness of breath. They prescribed Xanax (AER 2021434900). She said it did not work and they prescribed something else. It was 25 mg twice a day which was in a pharmacy vial. They then prescribed Lorazepam. She was afraid to take it. She took one instead of two. The dose was 0.25 mg twice daily. The ER did CT scan of chest with Contrast. It was negative for thromboembolism (also reported as CAT scan's negative for blood clots). She had shortness of breath before the vaccination and it got worse. She was managing it though. Outcome of left arm painful, foggy and not clear, did not have much energy/having no energy/low energy was resolving. Outcome of shortness of breath and hyperventilation was not resolved. Outcome of the other events was unknown. Information about lot/batch number has been requested.

68 2021-05-18 blood clot in lung Had headaches and felt nauseated; Had headaches and felt nauseated; Had a blood clot in her lungs; s... Read more
Close
Had headaches and felt nauseated; Had headaches and felt nauseated; Had a blood clot in her lungs; she had tripped and fallen; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 68-year-old female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; solution for injection; Lot Number: EN6206) via an unspecified route of administration on 16Apr2021 at 10:00 ("around 10:00 or so"; at the age of 68-years-old) as a single dose in the left arm for COVID-19 immunisation (the patient was "fearful of the new variants and wanted to be extra protected against those variants.") Medical history included COVID in Dec2020 and uses oxygen (normally used oxygen, but not all the time), from an unspecified date and unspecified if ongoing. Medical history was also reported as none. Relevant family history related to the adverse event was reported as none. Concomitant medications (other products) were reported as none. The patient did not receive prior vaccinations, within 4 weeks prior, or on the same date as the COVID-19 vaccine. The patient previously received iodine contrast dye on an unspecified date for an unspecified indication and experienced anaphylactic shock. The patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; solution for injection; Lot Number: EN6207) via an unspecified route of administration on (at the age of 68-years-old) as a single dose in the left arm for COVID-19 immunisation and experienced did not feel well, felt achy and nauseated (captured in AER: 2021495492). On 27Apr2021 the patient experienced had a blood clot in her lungs and she had tripped and fallen and on unspecified dates the patient experienced had headaches and felt nauseated. The course of events was reported as follows: "After the second dose of the vaccine the patient felt fine, she felt pretty much okay. She attributed that to her having had COVID back in Dec2020 based on her biological knowledge. She ran this idea past a pharmacist that said that generally people might take the first dose of the COVID vaccine and be fine and then be worse on the second dose. But since she had COVID in Dec2020 her second dose of the COVID vaccine was the problem like how people's antibodies were already built up and had that reaction so that is why she was fine. She was walking out of the hospital on 27Apr2021, there were people that had crossed in front of them very quickly and her foot had hit the foot of a lady that was pushing a gurney. The patient tripped and fell down and she was taken to the emergency room. In the emergency room, a doctor did some tests and shockingly the doctor said that the patient had a blood clot in her lungs. A physician's assistant told the patient that she needed to have a computerized tomography (CT) scan done. The patient needed to go home to take care of responsibilities there, so she walked out of the hospital. She did not know if she had a blood clot in her lungs or not. Her doctor said that the blood clot in her lungs was based off of two blood values. One was the d-dimer that had a reference value of < 500 and her level was 1,079 and the other blood work was troponin-I but it looked like it should be in the normal range because her level was less than 0.03 and the reference range was 0-0.04, so she would think that she would fall into the normal range. The d-dimer one was kind of scary. She had other tests done. They did a regular complete blood count (CBC) on her, another kind of test and another set of blood values but from looking at the results she was only a little low on a couple of things. They did not do the test with the contrast, but they did take an x-ray of her lung. The technician had found out that she had not had a Computed axial tomography (CAT) scan in a while, since she apparently needed them periodically, and she felt uneasy because that technician was urging her to get a CAT scan. The patient she did not know if these results were relevant or from the COVID vaccine. She did not understand this but when she was looking at the lab notice there was a note that the patient should be monitored for B Type Natriuretic Peptide (b/np) levels. It had the reference range on that one but when she read it, it looked like hers lied within the normal range. After the second dose she just had a headache but did not feel sick, but a week later they were telling her that she had a possible blood clot in her lungs. The patient was concerned at this point because she had no reason as to why she would have a possible blood clot. When she gets exhausted her oxygen drops and sometimes it will without her being exhausted. She was scared to go back to that one hospital. She was thinking about going to another hospital that was 60 miles away. If they would need to keep her overnight, she would need to make arrangements for her animals. She has had headaches, but they may be due to stress. She did not feel sick, other than she had been nauseated. The patient stated that she was not saying that what was reported on report 1 of 2 was due to the Pfizer COVID vaccine but why would they say that she had a blood clot too." The clinical outcomes of the events had a blood clot in her lungs, she had tripped and fallen, had headaches, and felt nauseated were all unknown.

A 68-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Solution for injection), dose 1 intramuscular, administered in Arm Left on 22Jan2021 10:45 (Batch/Lot Number: EL8982) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's Medical history included ongoing asthma (Verbatim: chronic asthma diagnosed when she was little, she has had asthma her whole life), c-diff from an unknown date and unknown (She confirms she was diagnosed with c-diff a few months prior to getting the vaccine), allergic to eggs from an unknown date, allergic: sulfa drugs, penicillin from an unknown date. The patient's Concomitant medications included fluticasone propionate, salmeterol xinafoate (ADVAIR) taken for asthma from an unspecified start date and ongoing; salbutamol (VENTOLIN [SALBUTAMOL]) taken for asthma from an unspecified start date and ongoing. The patient previously took codeine and experienced "allergic: codeine", flu and experienced allergic: flu shot. The patient experienced headaches (headache) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, nausea (nausea) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, sick (illness) (non-serious) on Jan2021, dizziness (dizziness) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, weakness (asthenia) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, no appetitive (decreased appetite) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, sore throat (oropharyngeal pain) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, weepy eyes (lacrimation increased) (non-serious) on Jan2021, stomach pain/ stomach spasms (abdominal pain upper) (non-serious) on Jan2021, puking her guts out/threw up (vomiting) (non-serious) on Jan2021, injection site pain (injection site pain) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, tired (fatigue) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, muscle pain (myalgia) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, joint pain (arthralgia) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, redness and swelling at the injection site (injection site erythema) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, redness and swelling at the injection site (injection site swelling) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, asthma is kicked up a little (asthma) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021, body aches (pain) (non-serious) on Jan2021, losing her voice (dysphonia) (non-serious) on Jan2021, hoarse voice (dysphonia) (non-serious) on 22Jan2021. She had a reaction to the Pfizer covid vaccine shot, she had the first dose on Friday 22Jan2021. She is still having a reaction. She is allergic to everything and she does not get flu shots for that reason. She is still sick, she still not feeling great. She experienced injection site pain, feeling tired, headaches, muscle pain, joint pain. She does not know if she had a fever. She has redness and swelling at the injection site but that is ok. She has nausea, dizziness, weakness, and sore throat. Reports her asthma is kicked up a little, she had to take a couple puffs of Advair and Ventolin right after she had the injection. She has chronic asthma. Her voice is hoarse from this, she is losing her voice. She threw up Sunday. She has no appetite. States all of her symptoms are improving very slightly. Treatment: She has been taking Emetrol for nausea. She is taking the generic for Lomotil called diphenoxyalte/atropine 1 by mouth 4 times a day as needed. She is taking ibuprofen 800 mg, one tablet by mouth three times a day, she took that for the first two days. She was taking Tylenol extra strength for body aches, 4 tablets a day. Occasionally she takes Aleve. She was taking other medications for her stomach since she was getting over c-diff. She was having horrible pain in her stomach. She has been taking vancomycin once every three days, she has about a weeks worth of vancomycin left. She confirms she was diagnosed with c-diff a few months prior to getting the vaccine. She took pantoprazole 40 mg and dicyclomine 10 mg to help her stomach, to help with her stomach pain. She is sleeping with a heating pad on her stomach, her stomach hurts like hell. She reached out to her doctor and advised her to wait and see how she is doing. She was told if she was not better by today she should go to the ER. States she will not go to the ER for fear of catching covid. Question: Call transferred from another line. The caller received the first dose of the vaccine on Friday 22Jan2021. The caller stated she has been sick since Friday and got worse on Sunday. She has experienced nausea, dizziness, weakness, no appetitive, a sore throat, she is losing her voice, she had to take inhaler right away after the injection, weepy eyes, and a lot of stomach pain. She is taking Lomotil to calm spasms in her stomach. She described the stomach spasms "like someone hit you in the gut and constantly throbbing, I used to get that when I had the regular flu and I don't get any of the vaccines because I am allergic to the by-products in the vaccines but they assured me it non of that was in this vaccine." She was puking her guts out at midnight on Sunday night. She has been staying in bed with a heating pad and has been in bed all week. Her doctor told her if she is no better by Friday she should go to the hospital but she does not want to go to the hospital. She stated she doesn't know if she should get the second dose. The caller asked if these symptoms have been reported and if there is anything she can do for it. Other line; agent (withheld). The outcome for the events "sick" was not recovered. The outcome for the event "losing her voice" was unknown. The outcome for the remaining events is recovering. Follow-up attempts completed. No further information expected.

felt the prickling and tingling in her chin and neck noting that it was only on her skin; rash / it as one solid circle that was about four inches, slightly raised, warm to the touch and bright red; pain; loss of taste and smell; loss of taste and smell; sit down and fall asleep; Sore ears; woke up like she couldn't breathe; when she swallowed it was irritated; pressure in her throat and ears; Nausea; Generally unwell; Sore Arm; Large, Red, Hot, Swollen, Painful area on Injection Arm; Large, Red, Hot, Swollen, Painful area on Injection Arm; Large, Red, Hot, Swollen, Painful area on Injection Arm; Sore throat; lethargy; tired; Headache; chills; painful lymph nodes on the left side (injection on the left side) then moved to the right axilla; Prickly Itchy area on left side of neck; pressure in her throat and ears; her arm got sore and in the night it felt like she was shot in the arm; nightmares; Caller stated it felt like she had covid again after the first dose; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable nurse (patient). A 69-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; solution for injection, lot number: ER8734, expiration date: unknown), via unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 04Apr2021 at 12:00 (at the age of 68-year-old) for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included COVID-19 had previously in late January/early February 2021. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. The patient had quite a reaction to the first dose of the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine stating she was told it was because she already had COVID then treated with advil and they went away. Patient felt like she had COVID again after the first dose which went away 2.5 - 3 weeks. Patient felt the prickling and tingling in her chin and neck noting that it was only on her skin. A week later the rash appeared in that area and it was quite red for a few days then it went away and prickling and itching still present used cortisone then changed to Aveeno. Eight hours after the first dose her arm got sore, and in the night, it felt like she was shot in the arm and took Advil and then the circle developed which described it as one solid circle that was about four inches, slightly raised, warm to the touch and bright red. The pain went away, decreasing over time and continued Advil over the next couple of weeks. On 04Apr2021, patient experienced headache, chills but no fever, painful lymph nodes on the left side (injection on the left side) then moved to the right axilla, sore throat and pressure in her throat and ears noting when she swallowed it was irritated and it went away after a few days, lethargy (lasted 1.5 to 2 weeks after the first dose) noting she would have to sit down and fall asleep. She reported that halfway through the day she would feel really tired. She had nightmares after the first vaccine and would wake up in the night yelling and she could not breathe, large, red, hot, swollen, painful area on Injection Arm, Sore ears, generally unwell, nausea and sore arm. Patient had loss of taste and smell but noted that it has not come back since she had COVID. She had the rash on her neck on her skin still bothers her off and on since the first dose. The first dose symptoms were more noticeable. The events were assessed as non-serious. Up until morning on 14May2021 still had chills, extreme fatigue, store throat and stuffy nose, sneezing like no tomorrow, one minute will have a runny nose and the next it will be stopped up and stuffy. She can't sleep but very tired. The first time was 2 days after the shot she went to urgent care because she couldn't breath and had all the symptoms, except diarrhea, and she wanted to be tested for COVID. They did a rapid and PCR and they were negative. She has had several rapid and PCR COVID test and all have been negative. On 09May2021, she went to the emergency room but was not admitted trying to find out why she was having these symptoms. She was given steroids and an inhaler to treat her symptoms. She has had an echo cardiogram, EKG, chest x-ray, sonogram of her stomach, blood tests, urine tests, and 9 covid tests all of which were negative and could not explain why she has been feeling the way that she feels. Patient was given Irbesartan when blood pressure high, azithromycin 250mg for 6 days which is also by Sandoz, albuterol sulfate inhaler 200puffs that is manufactured by Par, a steroid nose spray called Fluticasone Propionate 50mcg manufactured by Apots corp. She says she was gonna compare ingredients after she got the injection to see if there was anything similar. She says that the urgent care said her BP was high when they took that, then said just her excitement of having done, she says that hers is never high. She said she hadn't eaten since breakfast, though she doesn't know whether that would have anything to do with that, she didn't feel well, and still doesn't so she didn't go to work. The urgent care said if anything else happened to go back there or to emergency room, like if she had shortness of breath or was feeling more of what she had. Presented to ED who presents for evaluation of several complaints. Patient endorses having her first phase of vaccination early morning/afternoon yesterday. Becoming last night tachypneic and tachycardic per the husband to keep a close eye on her vital signs due to her extended complicated medical history. She began feeling short of breath yesterday evening which has persisted into the morning as well. She has been having about 12 hours of progressive now constant moderate/severe left-sided rib/left upper quadrant abdominal pain that radiates about this area and is stabbing in nature. Tachypnea because of most likely bilateral pleural effusion left more than right. Patient admitted. Bilateral pleural effusions left greater than the right. Patient underwent thoracentesis and about 600 cc of turbid fluid was removed. Fluid is neutrophilic exudate which is raised the possibility of acute inflammatory process. No pneumonia seen on the CAT scan but only compressive atelectasis. It is very concerning that patient's presentation is related to the Covid vaccination as an adverse effect. Initially she was placed on Maxipime and Flagyl but have been discontinued since. She was empirically started on high-dose steroids for this inflammatory state and eventually switched to tapering dose of prednisone. She will follow up with pulmonary in 2 weeks time with repeat chest x-ray.

69 2021-02-03 respiratory distress, shortness of breath The patient was referred by her primary care provider's office to receive COVID-19 vaccination. She ... Read more
Close
The patient was referred by her primary care provider's office to receive COVID-19 vaccination. She received her first dose of Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine at approximately 15:07 hrs. Due to her history of allergic reactions to multiple medications (including sulfa antibiotics and ceftriaxone), she was advised to extend her monitoring period to at least 30 minutes post-injection. At around 15:50 hrs I was notified that the patient was feeling a tingling sensation in her throat, itching, and a change in her voice. She was transferred to a stretcher for acute management of suspected anaphylaxis. Airway, breathing, circulation, and mentation were assessed immediately. EMS was called immediately via 911. Her vital signs were obtained, with a BP 168/90 mm/Hg, HR 105/min, RR 24/min. She reported shortness of breath at the time. There was no stridor or wheezing on exam. She appeared in mild respiratory distress. At 15:54 hrs she was given an intramuscular EpiPen injection (0.3 mg autoinjector) in her left thigh. At 15:58 she was given an intramuscular methylprednisolone injection (125 mg) in her right thigh. Immediately after that EMS team arrived and took over her care with plans to administer diphenhydramine intramuscularly, and will transfer to ED for further management. Throughout the event the patient remained awake, alert, and fully oriented.

69 yo female reports AE after receipt of Covid vaccine #1 (EN 5318 13 FEB 21) via drive thru event. She reports within minutes she felt unwell but had difficulty being more specific. She states she felt a warmth in her chest which traveled to her stomach. A few minutes later she felt SOB, and could not catch her breath. She states her respiratory rate increased. She talked to staff and was told if got worse to honk horn or use flashers. She did not request additional assessment. She waited her required 15 minutes and drove home another 20-25 minutes. She states she noted her face swelling. She thinks she may have had some throat swelling, but then wasn't sure. She developed some nausea, but no emesis which continued for 2-3 days. She denied watery or red eyes, runny nose, pruritis, rash, palpitations, heart racing, chest pain, cough wheezing. She states the breathing symptoms resolved in a few hours. She was unsure of the facial swelling resolution time frame. She developed a headache and felt malaise for 2-3 days, then symptoms resolved. She never took any medications other than her prescriptions. She did not seek care during symptom time frame.

shortness of breath; Tested positive; Tested positive; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Patient was not pregnant. Patient had no COVID prior vaccination. The patient had COVID test post vaccination and tested positive on 26Jan2021. Patient developed shortness of breath oxygen levels keep dropping on 03Feb2021. The events resulted in Emergency room/department or urgent care and hospitalization. It was unknown if patient received treatment for events. The outcome of events was unknown.

69 2021-02-23 shortness of breath She got the vaccine which was fine, at the end of the 20 minute waiting period had a spot the size o... Read more
Close
She got the vaccine which was fine, at the end of the 20 minute waiting period had a spot the size of a dime, really sore and pink. On her way home she started having bowel issues, got home and an hour to hour and half later got explosive diarrhea, which lasted 24 hours. The spot on her arm got larger, more tender and felt warm to touch. It got to be the size of a half softball size, no swelling. Then she started having trouble breathing, could not walk as far or fast without breathing problems. She then took it easy, and the breathing issues got worse for 36 hours. On Sunday her arm was better, less sore and the diarrhea had stopped. She then stopped improving and on Tuesday 2/16/21, she was told to go to the minute clinic on 2/18/21 and when she got there her pulse rate was 40, her oxygen level was 93, and her BP was elevated. The NP there she got her oxygen level up to 94, was real raspy in her lungs. She was sent to the UC and they sent her to the ER. She was seen in the ER and isolated her, did an EKG, had a chest x-ray, gave her breathing treatments, and waited on her results, which all came back fine. They gave her 150 mg of Prednisone, another breathing treatment and within 1 1/2 hours her oxygen level was up to 97 and all of her tests were negative and they sent her home. She has now been home since last Thursday with nebulizer treatments Ipratropium bromide and Albuteral sulfate 3 times a day, rescue inhaler 4 puffs every 6 hours, Advair twice a day as well. She does have a FU with her doctor tomorrow for recheck. She feels that she is almost back to normal.
69 2021-02-24 shortness of breath Within 20-minutes of vaccination, the patient reported pain in their throat, SOB, tingling in their ... Read more
Close
Within 20-minutes of vaccination, the patient reported pain in their throat, SOB, tingling in their arms, and chest pressure. EMS evaluated patient on-site. Patient was hypertensive (184/96). 12-lead EKG was NSR, rate of 79 bpm, no ST elevation. FSBG was 137 mg/dL. ETCO2 was 40mmHg with normal square waveform. EMS initiated transport to Hospital Emergency Department. En route, patient became more hypertensive (200/106). In ED, she remained hypertensive and was admitted to inpatient telemetry unit. Patient had 1-night stay to rule out cardiac-related events. Anaphylaxis was ruled out. Discharged with diagnosis of vaccine reaction and chest tightness.

69 2021-02-28 throat tightness Feeling numbness in her face around her cheeks and mouth/Her face was really tingling and numb; Feel... Read more
Close
Feeling numbness in her face around her cheeks and mouth/Her face was really tingling and numb; Feeling numbness in her face around her cheeks and mouth/Her face was really tingling and numb; Difficulty swallowing; Throat started to feel like it was closing up; Tongue got thick; Little blurred vision; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (the patient). A 69-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: UNKNOWN), via an unspecified route of administration, in the right arm on 26Jan2021 at 15:46 PM, (at the age of 69-year) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included hypertension, pacemaker insertion. Concomitant medication was not reported, however, the patient reported that she takes medicines for hypertension, and is on blood thinners. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. The patient reported that on 26Jan2021, after receiving the vaccination she did wait a half hour and the only symptoms she thought at the vaccination visit was a little blurred vision, which was temporary and went away. At 16:30, about 45 minutes to 1 hour after she left the vaccination center, as she was driving home, she informed that she was feeling numbness in her face around her cheeks and mouth/face was really tingling and numb, and she had difficulty swallowing; her throat started to feel like it was closing up and her tongue was really thick. She stated she tried to stay calm and forced herself to drink a bottle of water. She had no idea where there was any emergency area since she was not familiar with the area and tried to calm herself down and took sips of water and made sure she was breathing okay and it all went away. The reaction lasted 10-15 minutes and seem to resolve when she was able to calm herself down. She stated it was scary, and once she calmed down it all went away. She was concerned about receiving the second dose. She did not go to a physician or emergency room, but says she probably should have. The clinical outcome of little blurred vision, feeling numbness in her face around her cheeks and mouth/her face was really tingling and numb, difficulty swallowing, throat started to feel like it was closing up, and tongue got thick was recovered. The lot number for the vaccine, BNT162B2, was not provided and will be requested during follow up.

She reported feeling like her throat was closing and was also experiencing lightheadedness, apprehension, and numbness/tingling in her left hand. Her vital signs were monitored every 5 minutes for 20 minutes, and she was given 20 mL (50 mg) of liquid Diphenhydramine. Her signs and symptoms subsided, and she was ambulatory and stable with no distress at dismissal from clinic.

69 2021-03-05 shortness of breath One week after Vaccine #1 I began to have swelling & itching of the face-eyes, lips and cheeks, extr... Read more
Close
One week after Vaccine #1 I began to have swelling & itching of the face-eyes, lips and cheeks, extreme itching of both hands, massive diarrhea and some difficulty swallowing. I took oral benadryl (50 mg) and prednisone (@ 50 mg) and applied cold packs to my face and hands. I also took Allegra 180 mg LA 2x/daily for two weeks after the reaction. Vaccine dose 2 was administered on 2/17/2021 (Pfizer, Lot # EN6201) at Hospital, . One week after that (2/25/2021) I again had facial swelling and itching and massive diarrhea. I took Benadryl 25 mg and Allegra 2x/day and continue to do so. The facial swelling/itching continued. In addition I had, since the first vaccine, extreme fatigue, resulting in a decrease in my ability to walk (down from 3 miles to just over 1 mile) and to swim (shortness of breath, reduction in ability to swim laps). I visited my Rheumatologist on 3/2/2021 and he administered an injection of methylprednisolone to try and tamp down the continuing reaction. That seems to have made a difference.

69 2021-03-11 acute respiratory failure, shortness of breath, fluid in lungs, rapid breathing Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine EUA 3/2: Pt received Pfizer vaccine 2/26/2021 and started feeling progressi... Read more
Close
Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine EUA 3/2: Pt received Pfizer vaccine 2/26/2021 and started feeling progressively worse - endorsed fever, diarrhea, body aches, trouble breathing, lack of appetite. On 3/2/2021 pt and husband presented to ED. Pt's husband stated that pt had become more and more confused since she received the vaccine and that on 3/2 she could not complete her sentences. Temp 101.6 on arrival, tachycardic in 130s, tachypneic in 120s, but not hypoxic. Patient was given acetaminophen on arrival. IV was inserted and patient was given 1 L intravenous fluid replacement as well as 2 g ceftriaxone for broad-spectrum coverage within 3 hours of arrival. Blood work was drawn that shows no leukocytosis but lactic acidosis to 3.3. There are multiple electrolyte abnormalities, hyponatremia 127, hypokalemia 2.8, creatinine 1.01, ALT 59 AST 53, ALP 136, total bili 1.3, lactic acidosis 3.3, troponin 0.02. Patient was given 40 mEq of oral potassium. Additional L of normal saline was given for total of 2 L normal saline bolus. Chest x-ray shows right basilar pneumonia. Also shows pulmonary nodule of which husband was made aware. LFTs are noted be elevated, so biliary ultrasound was obtained that was negative with limit to body habitus. Husband was updated. Azithromycin was added on. Rapid COVID antigen was negative. 3/3/21: Febrile, SOB overnight. Pt more lethargic, trailing off in the middle of sentences and having difficulties following conversation. Continue sepsis protocol, add vancomycin IV to ceftriaxone and azithromycin. Frequent neuro checks. MRCP. Chest pain-free, serial cardiac enzymes from yesterday to demonstrate nonischemic pattern likely type 2 NSTEMI. 2/2 blood cultures from 3/2 positive for Streptococcus pyogenes (Group A). Vancomycin and azithromycin dc'd. 3/11: Discharged from hospital. Patient admitted for acute hypoxic respiratory failure secondary to right basilar community-acquired pneumonia. Blood culture grew Streptococcus pyogenes, patient was initially treated with ceftriaxone and switched to Ancef . repeat blood culture on 03/04/2021 showed no growth. Patient will complete a total 14 day course of antibiotics with amoxicillin from culture negative date. Patient had right-sided pleural effusion, pulmonary consulted and she underwent thoracentesis x2 culture showed no growth, considered parapneumonic effusion. Patient required 2 L continuous oxygen and deemed stable for discharge. She will follow up with Pulmonary in 3 weeks, outpatient chest CT in 4-6 weeks to be ordered by Pulmonary to assess lung nodule and known thoracic aortic aneurysm. PTOT recommended home discharge with VNA. On discharge patient was a febrile and hemodynamically stable. Remained COVID negative throughout.

I was up set; Muclse spams feel like something crawling in my leg; I feel crap. I got to work but feeling like I do I can't work; a slight temp 90.2; had choking episodes; feels like her throat is closing up when she is eating; Food get stuck in my throat; sleeping all day; tired; Headache; Nausea; This is a spontaneous report from a Pfizer-sponsored program. A contactable consumer (patient) reported that a 69-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot EN6201; Expiration Date: 30Jun2021), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 05Mar2021 as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included food allergies and meds allergies, anxiety, depression and blood pressure (abnormal). Concomitant medications included clonazepam (KLONOPIN) taken for anxiety from 2001, buspirone (BUSPIRONE) taken for anxiety from 2001, bupropion hydrochloride taken for depression from 2001, bupropion hcl taken for depression from 2001, and amlodipine besilate taken for blood pressure abnormal from 08Mar2021. On 05Mar2021 19:00, the patient experienced headache, and nausea. On 06Mar2021 19:00, the patient experienced sleeping all day, and was tired. On Day 2, she still had more side effects which wake her up. On 10Mar2021 19:00, the patient experienced had choking episodes, feels like her throat is closing up when she was eating, and food got stuck in her throat. On an unspecified date, the patient was upset and muscle spasms felt like something crawling in her leg and felt "crap"; she got to work but feeling like can't work. The patient reported that she had been having side effects and she was scared to have the shot because of her side effects and have when her body don't recognize it. She was asking when they go away. She has had a headache and nausea, was tired and sleeping all day. She felt like her throat was closing up when she eats. She had a choking episode and her grand daughter had to hit her on her back. She had choking episodes last night and this morning and she was now eating soft foods. She saw her doctor Monday for a regular appointment and she told him what happened. He wanted her to take the second dose but she was afraid to take it. She was afraid she will have worse side effects. Right now, she had nausea and drinking ginger ale. Her doctor called her which she was upset because he haven't seen her at all. Last time was 2019; and she just told him how she feel and want person to person. Patient reported she was not going to take 2nd dose because she do not want to go through anymore side effects. Everyone said that there were no side effects. That's wrong and she was having side-effects from day 1 on Friday night. There was an ingredient which she has allergies to. She told the nurse all meds allergies and food allergies which they told her that nothing in it will cause any side effects. They were wrong. She felt crap and she got to work but feeling like she can't work. Patient refused to take 2nd dose. Patient stated that she do not want to go through what she was going through now. The patient reported that she had a slight temp 90.2 on an unspecified date. The events required a visit to the physician office. The patient had no prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). Outcome of events choking episodes, nausea, tired, feels like her throat is closing up when she was eating, Food get stuck in my throat was not recovered; sleeping all day was recovered on 07Mar2021; headache was recovered on 10Mar2021; and outcome of the rest of events was unknown.

Within 30-minutes of vaccination, the patient reported shortness of breath, chills, dizziness, and chest pressure. EMS evaluated the patient on-site. The patient was hypertensive (223/180). EMS administered O2 2lpm via nasal cannula. In the ED, the patient reported they felt flushed with a headache. They remained hypertensive (167/89). ED physician admitted patient to inpatient telemetry unit for 1-day. Discharged with diagnosis of chest tightness with associated SOB and palpitations, reproducible on palpitation, troponin negative and EKG with no acute ST-T wave changes, no arrhythmia noted on telemetry, low likelihood of acute coronary syndrome. Patient was instructed to follow-up outpatient for PET stress test and 2D Echo.

This is a 70 year old female with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (anticoagualted on Eliquis), obstructive sleep apnea (uses CPAP), mitral valve regurgitation, remote tobacco use, hypertension and dyslipidemia who presents to the ED for worsening dyspnea, cough, subjective fever, chills and body aches that have been ongoing for the past several days. The patient indicates that her dyspnea is exacerbated with exertion but she denies chest pain, pleuritic chest pain, leg swelling or calf pain. She mentions that she has received both of her COVID-19 vaccines (Pfizer); the first immunization was on 02/25 followed by her second immunization which took place eight days ago on 03/18. She is not confident that she has had any contact with a known sick or definitive COVID-positive individual recently. Of note, the last documented incidence of testing for COVID-19 was performed on 10/31/2020 after the patient was seen at a Clinic after a exposure for a COVID-positive individual. Testing at that time had resulted negative. To her knowledge, she states that she had, in fact, tested positive for COVID-19 in late fall of 2020, but she was not hospitalized. Yesterday (3/26/2021), she was evaluated at a Pharmacy where she was testing for COVID-19 which has since resulted positive. The patient denies any other acute symptoms of illness. In the ED, the patient was found to have acute respiratory failure with hypoxemia and pneumonia due to SARS-CoV-2 infection. Review of Systems Constitutional: Positive for chills, fatigue and fever. Negative for activity change. Respiratory: Positive for cough and shortness of breath. Cardiovascular: Negative for chest pain and leg swelling. Gastrointestinal: Negative for abdominal pain, diarrhea, nausea and vomiting. Genitourinary: Negative for dysuria. Musculoskeletal: Positive for arthralgias and myalgias. Negative for gait problem. Neurological: Negative for syncope. All other systems reviewed and are negative. Vitals Blood pressure 159/79, pulse 65, temperature 36.4 °C (97.5 °F), temperature source Oral, resp. rate 18, height 1.6 m (5' 3"), weight 107 kg, SpO2 98 %. Physical Exam Vitals reviewed. Constitutional: General: She is awake. She is not in acute distress. Appearance: Normal appearance. She is well-developed. She is morbidly obese. She is ill-appearing. She is not toxic-appearing. Interventions: Nasal cannula in place. HENT: Head: Normocephalic and atraumatic. Nose: Congestion present. Mouth/Throat: Mouth: Mucous membranes are dry. Pharynx: Oropharynx is clear. Cardiovascular: Rate and Rhythm: Normal rate and regular rhythm. Pulses: Normal pulses. Heart sounds: Normal heart sounds. Pulmonary: Effort: Pulmonary effort is normal. Breath sounds: Decreased breath sounds present. Comments: Diminished breath sounds in all lung fields. Occasional cough. Abdominal: General: Bowel sounds are normal. There is no distension. Palpations: Abdomen is soft. Tenderness: There is no abdominal tenderness. Musculoskeletal: General: Normal range of motion. Cervical back: Normal range of motion and neck supple. Skin: General: Skin is warm and dry. Neurological: General: No focal deficit present. Mental Status: She is alert and oriented to person, place, and time. Psychiatric: Behavior: Behavior is cooperative.

mild nausea; Syncope (2x) w/mild seizure; Syncope (2x) w/mild seizure; Flu-like symptoms; chills; joint/muscle pain; joint/muscle pain; injection site pain; headache; labored breathing; dry-heaving after second syncope; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient herself). A 69-year-old female patient, not pregnant, received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: LOT 6205 (as reported)), via an unspecified route of administration in the right arm, on 08Mar2021, at a single dose, for covid-19 immunization. The patient has no medical history and has no known allergies. Concomitant medications included sertraline; docusate sodium, ferrous fumarate (FERRO-SEQUELS); and multivitamin - all taken for unspecified indications, start and stop dates were not reported. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number EN6201) on 15Feb2021 17:00 in the right arm for covid-19 immunization at 69-years-old. The patient did not have covid prior vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccines in four weeks. The vaccine was given at the public health clinic. The following day on 09Mar2021 15:30 after a short walk, the patient experienced flu-like symptoms, chills, joint/muscle pain, injection site pain, headache, syncope (2x) with mild seizure, labored breathing, and dry-heaving after second syncope. The patient was then taken by ambulance to the ER (resulted in an emergency room visit) and was given saline fluids via IV. The vitals and EKG were "ok" on 09Mar2021. The patient recovered relatively quickly and was released. The only symptoms remaining on 11Mar2021 were mild headache and mild nausea. The patient had not recovered from headache and nausea at the time of the report; while recovered outcomes on Mar2021 for all the other remaining adverse events. The patient was not covid-tested post-vaccination.

Her D-dimer was elevated. Per the EUA, hospitalizations are to be reported irrespective of attribution to vaccine.

69 2021-03-31 shortness of breath, respiratory rate increased Post administration patient was discharged to observation by medical assistant to me. I was in the l... Read more
Close
Post administration patient was discharged to observation by medical assistant to me. I was in the lobby providing break coverage. Patient presented with known COPD and Tremors. Patient had a slight cough when she initially sat down. After about 5-10 minutes I noted that her respatory rate had increased and coughing had continued. I checked in with the patient and asked how she was feeling initially she reported some nausea no complaints of her breathing. I told the patient that I would be getting the provider just to check things out. Onsite Provider agreed that patient should be brought to an exam room. Patient walked on her own to Exam room 3. Upon arriving in exam room 3, provider noted hives and arm redness instructed me to deliver Epi. 0.3mg Epi via auro injector was administered at 10:27 to the left thigh area. About 1029 patients breathing did get better. Patient remained alert and conscious. 1032 patient breathing became difficult again, ordered another round of 0.3mg Epi to the right thigh. 1033 breathing was feeling better, ordered patient to use her own Ventolin inhaler to help with some of the breathing problems. 1035 ordered 0.5mg of IM Benadryl, however paramedics arrived on scene and resumed care. Clinic Benadryl was not administered. Patient was transported to ER via Ambulance to hospital for further care.

Close
severe pain in her upper middle part to the right portion of her back; pain is in the muscles; she couldn't take a deep breath; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 69-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE Solution for injection) dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 10Mar2021 13:45 (69-year-old at time of vaccination) (Batch/Lot Number: EN6204) at a single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included ongoing blood cholesterol d and thinks she was diagnosed about 3 years ago. Patient was taking unspecified statins 5 mg, once a day, by mouth. Patient got the first dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine on 10Mar2021 (Sunday). On 14Mar2021 at 10AM, she experienced a localized severe pain in her upper middle part to the right portion of her back. She said that it is a pain in the muscle where her scapula pulls and maybe the muscle that covers the lung. Because of that pain she couldn't take a deep breath. She has tried different things such as taking Tylenol and placing ice packs to numb the pain. It presented until yesterday (15Mar2021) then it became better, then it came back again last night. She was feeling better today. She can't think of anything physical that might have contributed to her adverse event. She is scheduled for her second shot on 31Mar2021. Additional information included that there was a horrible sharp pain on the right side of her back underneath the scapula, hurt like crazy, couldn't take a deep breath . Patient took Pfizer BioNTech Covid vaccine (Verbatim): so that she will be able to see her grandkids again, and she wants to be safe. Patient reported she did not do anything to injure herself, so she was wondering if this could be caused by the vaccine. the pain was almost gone today; she can take a deep breath and it only hurts a little bit. She could not take a deep breath yesterday (14Mar2021), but she can today (15Mar2021). She described that it was really bad yesterday. She wants to know if other people have reported the pain on the muscle that goes around the back of the lung. She asked if this was related to the shot. The vaccine was given in a high school gym. There was no history of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect neither additional vaccine administered on same date. Patient did not require to visit emergency room and physician office. She added thather husband received the vaccine at the same time and he didn't have any reactions. She also reports she was tested one time for covid and it was negative; clarified this was months ago and she doesn't remember any testing that came out bad. Outcome of the events back pain and muscle pain were unknown while Dyspnea was recovering.

Prior to vaccination, patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, patient has not been tested for COVID-19. Facility where the most recent COVID-19 vaccine was administered was Hospital. Did the patient receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine: No. List of any other medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination: None. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Patient was in very good health/exercise - take no medications. It began to subside about 30 min later, but patient felt very weak for about two hours. Her doctor said she should not take the second dose. Treatment was not received for the adverse event. The outcome was recovered on an unspecified date in 2021. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

69 2021-04-05 shortness of breath On 3/24, I woke up nauseous, extremely fatigued, with sore joints, headache, and abdominal pain. A ... Read more
Close
On 3/24, I woke up nauseous, extremely fatigued, with sore joints, headache, and abdominal pain. A few days later I noticed I had extreme shortness of breath. I went to see my PCP on or about 3/31. He listened to my heart and discovered a rapid heartbeat. He then took an EKG. He wanted to put me on lifetime meds immediately. I was in shock because I truly believe this is a reaction to the COVID vaccine. I have never had arrhythmia. In fact, I had a wellness visit with the Dr. about 3 months previously and all was good. I have been seeing him for four years since I moved. He does not think my new diagnosis is related to a vaccine reaction, but I find it highly suspect that 4 other women in my large circle of friends also have AFIB after 2nd shot. I spent Easter in the ER and they pumped Metoprolol in my bloodstream. I did not stay in the hospital that night. I went to see the Dr. on Monday morning on 4/4. He prescribed Metroprolol 25 mg and Xarelto 20 mg IMMEDIATELY. I picked up the meds and started this regimen. In speaking with other women, I believe this terrible diagnosis is a direct result as a reaction from the vaccine.

Close
blood clot in the lung; my left leg from the knee down started to swell; my left leg from the knee down started to swell, get really hard and became very painful/I could hardly walk and after and pain was so intense; my left leg from the knee down started to swell, get really hard and became very painful/I could hardly walk and after and pain was so intense; blood clot in the leg; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 69-year-old female patient (patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination) received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, Lot number: EN3248, Expiry date: unknown) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 16Feb2021, 15:30 PM at a single dose for covid-19 immunisation (age at vaccination was 69 years). Medical history included blood pressure and thyroid. Concomitant medication patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination included levothyroxine, valsartan, furosemide, acetaminophen. No other vaccine was received within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 16Feb2021, 3 hours after the patient received the vaccination at 18:30 the patient's left leg from the knee down started to swell, got really hard and became very painful. She could hardly walk and afterwards the pain was so intense that she went to the doctor. Doctor took X-rays of her left leg on 16Feb2021, then he diagnosed her with blood clots. He gave the patient 2 heparin shots and immediately sent her to the hospital for a deep vein ultrasound on 16Feb2021. The results showed blood clot in the leg. The patient was prescribed medication and sent home. Her leg continued to be rock hard and painful. On 02Mar2021, the patient was sent for a blood panel work up. There was no improvement. On 08Mar2021, the doctor sent her for a lung CT scan. On the same evening, the patient was called to the doctor's office and was sent to ER immediately as the results showed blood clot in the lung. The patient's dose of Eliquis was doubled. This has now been going for 5 weeks, the patient had not been without pain during this time. Her left leg hardness had gone down a little but was still twice the size of her right leg, knee was huge. The swelling never goes down, not even at night. No covid prior vaccination and no covid tested post vaccination was reported. This case was reported as serious. The outcome of all the events was not recovered. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

69 2021-04-13 shortness of breath The patient began experiencing dizziness and lightheadedness while shopping after getting her covid ... Read more
Close
The patient began experiencing dizziness and lightheadedness while shopping after getting her covid vaccine. She felt fine immediately after the shot and during her 15 minute observation time. While shopping after she began feeling dizzy and was given water, a cool towel, and sat down. When I arrived she was breathing heavily and had trouble speaking. Her color was good. Her initial blood pressure was 139/80, pulse 89. After 15 minutes of rest her blood pressure was 126/109, pulse 90. She reported she hadn't eaten lunch so we offered her food or juice. She chose to eat some nuts and dried cherries she purchased and reported that she felt better. The EMS arrived, gave her a workup, and she eventually left on her own.

69 2021-04-25 shortness of breath, fluid in lungs Patient is a 69-year-old woman with newly diagnosed pericarditis in March 2021, hypertension, hyperl... Read more
Close
Patient is a 69-year-old woman with newly diagnosed pericarditis in March 2021, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and hypothyroidism, who presented to the Emergency Department (ED) with progressively worsening chest pain, dyspnea, and fatigue. Patient was in her usual state of health until 3/1/2021, when she developed sudden-onset pain "across the entire chest". She shares that her symptoms "came out of the blue", as "suddenly one day, everything just hurt". She saw her primary care physician, who initially felt her symptoms were due to acid reflux. As such, the patient started "eating antacids and omeprazole like candy". However, her chest pain persisted, prompting her to follow up with her primary care physician on 3/16/2021. At that time, ECG reportedly showed normal sinus rhythm and no acute changes. CT of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis with contrast showed abnormal enhancement and thickening of the pericardium with trace pericardial fluid, consistent with pericarditis. The patient was therefore started on colchicine and an ibuprofen taper. On 4/5/2021, Patient sent a myVM portal message to her primary care physician and cardiologist, expressing her belief that her chest pain has remained unchanged over the past month. She continues to experience a constant burning sensation throughout her chest, aggravated by deep inspiration and alleviated by lying flat on her back. She shares that walking up the stairs at home leaves her "breathless". Associated symptoms include subjective fevers, chills, and night sweats. Given these symptoms, Patient underwent a chest x-ray, which showed findings consistent with an enlarging pericardial effusion. Patient was then advised to present to the ED for further workup as an inpatient. At time of hospital admission, patient endorses persistent chest pain during inspiration. Prior to 3/1/2021, she has never experienced these symptoms and reports no history of pericarditis. The most strenuous physical activity she has undertaken in the last month include working in the garden and caring light boxes down the stairs. She is most concerned about the fluid around her heart. Patient reports no nausea, vomiting, palpitations, constipation, diarrhea, or abdominal pain. Of note, the patient developed pericarditis 10 days after her second COVID-19 vaccine. Hospital Course # Sub-acute pericarditis with enlarging pericardial effusion Pericarditis initially diagnosed in March 2021, thought to be potentially from her COVID-19 vaccine given time course as no other clear etiology apparent. Pt was hemodynamically stable with an elevated jugular venous pressure at time of admission, with CXR consistent with an enlarging pericardial effusion. Echo 04/05 with small circumferential pericardial effusion but no tamponade physiology. Cardiac MRI on 4/7 with enlargement of moderate-sized pericardial effusion but otherwise negative exam, with no evidence of myocarditis or infiltrative myocardial process. ANA screen negative, rheumatoid factor and anti-CCP not elevated Blood cultures x 2 with no growth - CRP continued to remain > 160 with ibupofen and colchicine. Prednisone 20 mg PO daily was added on 4/7, with subsequent improvement in patient's symptoms. - Discharged on regimen of prednisone 20 mg PO daily and colchicine 0.3 mg PO daily (reduced from 0.6 mg daily that she was taking prior to admission). She will also continue using ibuprofen 800 mg BID. - Follow-up with Dr (cardiology) next week to follow-up on hospitalization and decide upon tapering plan for her medications
69 2021-04-25 shortness of breath developed SOB with Negative work up of COVID 19, symptoms progressed, resulted in hospitalization. T... Read more
Close
developed SOB with Negative work up of COVID 19, symptoms progressed, resulted in hospitalization. There diagnosis of Myasthenia gravis crisis.
69 2021-04-26 shortness of breath shortness of breath; productive cough; a lot of throat congestion; she felt like she woke up with a ... Read more
Close
shortness of breath; productive cough; a lot of throat congestion; she felt like she woke up with a cold; felt hot; she couldn't sleep,; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 69-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: ER8737, expiration date: 30Jul2021, NDC number: 59267-1000-02), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in the left deltoid on 08Apr2021 10:30 at single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included ongoing fibromyalgia. Patient stated she has had fibromyalgia for about 20 years. She said she had a fibromyalgia flare up with increased back pain, and had a Toradol 60mg intramuscular injection in her left hip on Tuesday, 06Apr2021. Concomitant medication included ketorolac tromethamine (TORADOL) for fibromyalgia from 06Apr2021. It was reported she had her first COVID-19 vaccine injection on Thursday 08Apr2021 at 10:30AM. She said that night (08Apr2021) she couldn't sleep and woke up at 3:00AM (09Apr2021) with shortness of breath, productive cough, and throat congestion. She said she had so much throat congestion, she could hardly talk. She clarified she felt like she woke up with a cold. She said she still had the productive cough, but her other symptoms went away by 8:30AM-9:00AM on 09Apr2021. She said she hadn't had a cold in 4 years. She said she read something on the internet that suggested her symptoms may be due to having the COVID-19 virus prior to getting the COVID-19 Vaccine. She said if she had the COVID-19 virus prior to getting her first COVID-19 Vaccine, she was totally asymptomatic. She said she wanted to know what she should do. Patient further reported she felt her shortness of breath was medically significant because she was mouth breathing. She clarified she felt hot during that time, and took her temperature, which was 97 degrees. She said she thought the fact she was hot was medically significant because she thought she may have a bad respiratory infection or something. The patient was not brought to the emergency room or physician's office in response to the events. The patient recovered from shortness of breath, felt hot, throat congestion on 09Apr2021; recovering from productive cough, and unknown outcome for the remaining events. The events were assessed as related with bnt162b2.
