75 2021-04-17 chronic obstructive pulmonary disease Exacerbation of COPD/having trouble breathing; extremely tired, couldn't get out of bed, couldn't mo... Read more
Close
Exacerbation of COPD/having trouble breathing; extremely tired, couldn't get out of bed, couldn't move/tiredness; weakness; bleeding; Test: Iron; Result: Critically low; red blood cell was below 5; administered at the left upper forearm; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient) via Pfizer. A 75-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported, NDC number: 59267-1000-02), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in the left upper forearm on 01Mar2021 at the age of 75-years-old as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The vaccine was administered to the patient at a pharmacy (in a grocery store). The patient had no prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). The patient's medical history included retired (retired registered nurse), ongoing depression (has had this condition for probably 20 years), ongoing lung cancer (has had this condition for probably 3 years), ongoing bipolar (has had this condition for about 4 years), ongoing emphysema (has been severe for about 4 or 5 years), and ongoing chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) (has been severe for about 4 or 5 years). Concomitant medications included duloxetine taken for depression from an unspecified start date and ongoing (been taking this probably for 15 years); and arformoterol tartrate (BROVANA) (started taking this probably 5 years ago), budesonide (started taking this probably 5 years ago), tiotropium bromide (SPIRIVA) (has been taking this for probably about 4-5 years), oxygen (has been using this full time for 3 years), and Trilogy machine (she sleeps with this, it is an invasive intubation. She puts a big mask on and it pumps air in, pulls air out, letting her lungs rest. Her oxygen hooks up to it), all taken for emphysema and COPD from an unspecified start date and ongoing. The patient reported that she received the vaccine on 01Mar2021 and sometime in Apr2021 around Easter, she went to the hospital for COPD exacerbation, tiredness and weakness. The patient required a visit to the emergency room due to the events and reported that she went by ambulance to the hospital. The patient stated that she has these events often and it has nothing to do with the COVID vaccine. She went to the hospital with exacerbation of COPD and missed her date to get her last shot. She wanted to know whether she can get the 2nd dose of the vaccine with her experience after the 1st dose. The patient reported that she now weighs 177 after she has been pumped full of cortisone. The patient reported that her lung doctor was really the one that manages her medical. The patient reported that she thinks she came home from the hospital the day before Easter and she was in the hospital for 5 days (in Apr2021). She was sick before that, at home, and she finally had to call # to come and get her. She believes she had to call # the 5th day before Easter, but she was not positive. When asked to clarify what she meant by sick, the patient explained she was extremely tired, she couldn't get out of bed and couldn't move. She was having trouble breathing. She was on oxygen 24/7 and sleeps with a trilogy machine so she was having a lot of trouble, it was awful. She said she then found out at the hospital her red blood cell was below 5 and her iron was critically low. They had to give her 2 units of blood and an infusion. Then she went back yesterday and got another infusion and she has to go back next week for another infusion. The patient confirmed that she was hospitalized for COPD. She then stated she didn't know the exact date of when she was discharged from the hospital, but she was thinking it was the day she was scheduled for her second shot. She then clarified she came home Easter. The patient reported that she can't do much without having to sit down, catch her breath, and rest a little bit. She was improving but not as fast as she'd like to. While reading the vaccine record card, the patient stated "my eyes aren't as good as they used to be". Her pulmonologist stated she was going to die if she doesn't take the vaccine. If she catches COVID she was not going to make it, so her pulmonologist thinks her chances are better with the vaccine than without it. The patient said she goes all the time to the hospital; therefore, she doesn't think the events were related to the vaccine. She had been sick several times. They can't do anything about the bleeding, they can't go in to do anything because of her lungs, her lungs were so bad. No further details were provided regarding the bleeding she was speaking of. The patient reported that duloxetine doesn't come as 90 mg so she takes a 30 mg and 60 mg tablet; she mixes the Brovana and Budesoind and takes them at the same time, twice a day. She was given an albuterol solution, 0.5mg PRN (as needed), for her emphysema/COPD. She says she just started taking this from her last hospital stay. The patient reported that she did not remember her iron count, just that it was critically low. She did remember asking the nurse what could happen, and the nurse said a lot of things such as infection. She confirmed tests were done in regards to the lung cancer. Her lungs were too critical for any kind of invasive tests. It was reported that the events Exacerbation of COPD and "extremely tired, couldn't get out of bed, couldn't move" were assessed by the patient as unrelated to BNT162B2. The outcome of the events "Exacerbation of COPD/having trouble breathing" and " extremely tired, couldn't get out of bed, couldn't move/tiredness" was recovering, while the outcome of the other events was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on the narrative information provided, the reported events Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, Fatigue, Asthenia, Blood iron decreased, Red blood cell count decreased and Asthenia are assessed as intercurrent medical conditions and unrelated to BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection). The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to RAs, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

having a heart attack; couldn't breath; lungs were filled-up with fluid; felt like a pin cushion; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 75-year-old female patient received the second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot Number: EN9581), via an unspecified route of administration on 06Feb2021 as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included breast cancer/her breast cancer had came back in the same place from 2006, both breasts removed on 2006. Concomitant medication included palbociclib (IBRANCE) taken for breast cancer female from 24Jun2020 to 04Feb2021 then from 01Apr2021 and ongoing. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 (lot number: EL3248) on 17Jan2021 for COVID-19 immunization and experienced acute bronchitis. On 14Feb2021, the patient was taken by an ambulance and was hospitalized because she couldn't breath, they thought she was having a heart attack, her lungs were filled-up with fluid. The doctors had her on oxygen while she was in the hospital, and did heart and lung tests on her on an unspecified date in 2021. While in the hospital, the patient felt like a pin cushion on an unspecified date. The patient left the hospital on 17Feb2021. The patient was tested for COVID-19 three times on unspecified dates all with negative results. the patient was hospitalized again on 25Feb2021 to 01Mar2021 for reasons not reported. The outcome of the events she couldn't breath, thought she was having a heart attack, her lungs were filled-up with fluid was recovered on 17Feb2021, while for the event felt like a pin cushion was unknown.
75 2021-05-10 shortness of breath, fluid in lungs On 3/23/21 pt had SOB so went to went to the Hospital ER. She had lab work, CT, Chest Xray, ECG 12 ... Read more
Close
On 3/23/21 pt had SOB so went to went to the Hospital ER. She had lab work, CT, Chest Xray, ECG 12 lead. DX is pneumonia of right lower lobe of the lung. She was given Augmentin and released after 7 hours and told to FU w/ PCP. On 3/31/21 pt went to see her PCP due to having SOB. She was given a Covid Test which was negative. She was sent home and told to breath deeply and hopefully this symptom would go away. On 4/18/21 she went back to the Hospital ER for SOB. Pt was admitted with acute DVT and other blood clots as well as pleural effusion of the right lung. They did US on legs and Chest X-Rays. They found fluid around her right lung which they drained. She was prescribed Eliquis. Pt was discharged on 4/21/2021 and was told to FU w/ PCP. On 4/24/21 pt went back to the Hospital ER, because she had a bruising/blood clots in the groin area. She had 3 blood clots on the left side and one on the right side. They told her the bruising was from the Eliquis and they did a US. She was told she had the same blood clots that she had during her hospital stay and they were right where they were before. She was discharged. On 4/29/2021 she went back to her PCP due to SOB. She told her PCP about the DVT that was bothering her. She was sent to another Hospital. She had a stat Chest X-Ray- results were that her lungs were stable with inflammation around the right lung. She was told to FU w/ PCP in July 2021 and go back to ER if she had another episode w/ SOB.
75 2021-05-11 shortness of breath, asthma, acute respiratory failure past medical history significant for asthma, pulmonary sarcoidosis, hypertension presents to the hos... Read more
Close
past medical history significant for asthma, pulmonary sarcoidosis, hypertension presents to the hospital with fever, cough and worsening dyspnea. Patient had struggles with asthma exacerbation in February 2021 and since then has never felt back to her baseline in spite of 3 separate prednisone courses. Most recently she finished a prednisone course just prior to this hospitalization. It is unclear when her symptoms that are specific to COVID-19 started. Nonetheless she was tested negative for COVID-19 prior to most recent prednisone start but did test positive at this ER visit. Patient admitted for COVID-19 pneumonia associated with acute hypoxic respiratory failure.
75 2021-05-31 shortness of breath strong headaches; dry eyes; fatigue; upset stomach; the cough again changed from dry to wet but very... Read more
Close
strong headaches; dry eyes; fatigue; upset stomach; the cough again changed from dry to wet but very severe; sometimes I had to cough hard that I couldn't catch my breath; my temperature went up to 99.7; could eat barely anything; she was very shaky; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer or other non hcp (patient). This is the second of 2 reports from the same reporter involving the same patient. The patient experienced adverse events with both 1st and 2nd dose of the vaccine. This is for the second dose of the vaccine. A 75-year-old (age at the time of vaccination) female patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Solution for injection; Lot number: unknown), via an unspecified route of administration on 18Feb2021 as 0.3ml, single dose for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included hypertension, arthritis, normally a migraine sufferer, oesophageal disorder, irritable bowel syndrome, covid-19 (in Apr-2020), feeling abnormal, pneumonia, bronchitis, breathing difficulty, cough. Consumer stated that she had something with esophagus so she was taking for digestive because she had 'IBS', in April of last year she was diagnosed with corona virus. She had little bit of breathing difficulty and bronchitis was confirmed with X-ray. Covid was confirmed two days later. About 3 weeks later she felt bad again and she had to go to the emergency room the hospital here and she had pneumonia and received very good medication (treatment) and like the five pills which they give for pneumonia and they wanted to admit her to the hospital, she was in the emergency room for 6 hours and that was enough and they made another Covid test and that was negative but it was the X-ray shown that she had pneumonia. Concomitant medications included calcium (CALCIUM), colecalciferol (VITAMIN D [COLECALCIFEROL]), cyanocobalamin (VITAMIN B12 [CYANOCOBALAMIN]), fluticasone propionate (FLONASE [FLUTICASONE PROPIONATE]). Received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Solution for injection; Lot number: FL9264), via an unspecified route of administration on 28Jan2021 as 0.3ml, single dose for covid-19 immunization and experienced fever, chills, fatigue, extremely dry eyes and felt hot, they were so dry she had to pull over on the side to drive home; arm was a little bit sore, slight headache, Ice cold hands and feet, shaky, had absolutely no appetite, she was not thirsty and very little urine output, runny nose, she had almost from years a dry cough and this one turned wet, had a very upset stomach that she could not eat or drink anything, extremely tired and it felt like she had the flu, she had a heartbeat for three days which was faster than normal and that lasted for about three days. On an unspecified date, after the second dose of vaccination the patient experienced strong headaches, dry eyes, fatigue and upset stomach, though slightly shorter in duration than she experienced following the first dose. She again had dry eyes, the cough again changed from dry to wet but very severe and sometimes she had to cough hard that she could not catch her breath after second dose. The headache had changed from the first one, it was slight headache for few days but with this it was for three or four days she had headache, her stomach was a bit upset and she could not take a pill (Unspecified Medication). Her headache was severe as if she had a helicopter in there and then extremely tired. She had to go to the bathroom, and she went to bed and thought that she was going to lay down for about five minutes, but she woke about two and a half hours later. Every step she had to walk was almost too much and then my temperature went up to 99.7 and she was very shaky. The headache lasted for about 3 or 4 days and then it was over. She has never had any side effect from any vaccine. She could not take anything for the headache because she thought she will throw up. In the morning, she just took her regular medicine (Unspecified Medications). She could eat barely anything like she said after three or four days. Consumer stated that her height was 5 feet 3 inches, and she shrank some. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included sars-cov-2 test positive: positive, x-ray resulted bronchitis. The outcome of the event headache was resolved whereas the outcome of other events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.
75 2021-06-01 shortness of breath After the vaccine, the patient became dizzy/lightheaded in her chair. She moved to the floor. Vital ... Read more
Close
After the vaccine, the patient became dizzy/lightheaded in her chair. She moved to the floor. Vital signs monitored, initially not responsive once lowered to the ground. RN immediately called for a med kit, 911 called within the minute. History of pre-diabetes. O2 sats 96%, BP up to 200, elevated HR. The patient was withdrawing to pain, responding to sternal rub, did appear at one point to be gasping for air, and admin of 0.3 mg of epi was attempted but not given because it would not go in. AED unit was applied but no shock received. EMT arrived 10 min after called and the patient started to become more reactive, asking for her granddaughter. EKG administered and BP lowered to 130/80. The patient was taken to Hospital.
75 2021-06-01 throat tightness anaphylactic reaction; both of the palms were crazy itchy and red/ face was red; both of the palms w... Read more
Close
anaphylactic reaction; both of the palms were crazy itchy and red/ face was red; both of the palms were crazy itchy and red; throat got kind of constricted; Sore throat; Fever; uvula was larger and red; uvula was larger and red; really tired; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Other health care professional. A 75-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Lot number: EL9265, Expiration date: 31May2021, NDC number: Unknown), intramuscularly in left upper arm on 29Jan2021 09:20 AM at single dose for preventative/ COVID-19 immunisation in hospital. The patient's medical history included thyroid from an unspecified date in Aug2020 and ongoing, ongoing high blood pressure (diagnosed about a year to a year and a half ago), ongoing osteoporosis (diagnosed over 10 years ago). Patient had history of allergies to Codeine and non steroidal anti inflammatory (NSAIDS). The patient was not taking any medication prior to the event being reported. Patient did not receive any recent vaccines for any other conditions prior to the event being reported. Patient did not receive any recent vaccines for SARS-CoV2 other than Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine prior to the event . Patient did not received any other vaccines around the time of Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine. There was no multiorgan involvement. Concomitant medications included ongoing amlodipine besylate (Formulation: Tablet, Strength: 2.5 mg) at 2.5 mg, once a day for blood pressure, ongoing levothyroxine sodium (Formulation: Tablet, Strength: 50 ug), orally at 50 ug, once a day (50mcg tablet once a day at night) for thyroid, ongoing calcitonin/ salmon via nasal at once a day (one squirt in each nostril once a day, alternating nostrils) (states it was a spray and she reads 200 unit/act sprAPOT) for osteoporosis. She would be checked on 18Feb2020 to see if her medication needs to be changed. Prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks) was none. Adverse events following prior vaccinations was none. Additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer suspect was none. She got the first dose of the Pfizer vaccine last Friday. She got a whole bunch of paperwork and it said if there was a possible side effect to report it. Reports something really weird happened on Tuesday. At first it seemed like it had to be a side effect because she didn't do anything abnormal or out of her routine. She was eating breakfast and both palms of her hands started itching like crazy, it was a crazy itch on 02Feb2021. Her palms were all red which may have been from her rubbing them to try and get rid of the itch on 02Feb2021, this went away the same day. Her throat got kind of constricted on 02Feb2021 and by the next morning it was better. She could breath and swallow, but it felt really thick. She looked in the mirror, and the thing that hangs down, she clarifies her uvula was larger and very red on 02Feb2021. Her face was also red. She sat it out and took her vitals. She was tired but it did not stop her, she still did a two-mile walk. States she was fine enough to do that. Her throat was sore on 02Feb2021 all day and into the night, her sore throat on 02Feb2021 was the longest lasting side effect, it recovered the next day. Her fever was 99.5 on 02Feb2021 and states her temperature was usually 97 or 96. Her pulse ox was 96. Her pulse was 70. Her blood pressure was 138/76, which was not abnormal for her first thing in the morning. She felt abnormally really tired on an unspecified date in Feb2021. She took Tylenol. She was fine with everything by Wednesday. The following day it was all done and over with. Patient experienced itchy,Red palms,sore throat,swollen uvula,too urinating,welling instill less than 24 hours.4 days later the patient had anaphylactic reaction. Patient did not required medical intervention. Patient was not seen in emergency department. She was not hospitalized. She was not admitted to an intensive care unit. Patient was given Benadryl. Her and her husband went to get the vaccine together. He did not have anything like this. She was thankful to Pfizer for making the vaccine. She just experienced a little blip in her day, she was not complaining. Weight: 128-130 pounds. The adverse events did not require a visit to emergency room and physician office. Relevant tests was none. Investigation assessment was none. The outcome of the event really tired was unknown, recovered on an unspecified date in Feb2021 for the events uvula was larger and red, fever, recovered on 03Feb2021 for the events sore throat, throat got kind of constricted and recovered on 02Feb2021 for the other events. The patient was recovered from anaplylactic reactions. The Pfizer product had a causal effect to the adverse event Follow-up 02Mar2021: Significant information received and updated. This is a follow-up spontaneous report from a contactable Other HCP. This Other HCP reported in response to HCP letter sent. Updated reporter in case and in narrative. Upgraded case to serious by adding anaphylactic reaction as an event. Added patient medical history. Added outcome and updated narrative.

Close
Pericarditis, Pericardial effusion, Pleural effusion and Atrial fibrillation. Treatments were pericardiocentesis, pleuralcentesis four times. Was given antibiotics, colchicine, lasix, Dofetilide, Carvedilol and Eliquis.
75 2021-06-09 respiratory rate increased Problem swallowing; Attack to her lymph nodes; arm was swollen, the one that she received the vaccin... Read more
Close
Problem swallowing; Attack to her lymph nodes; arm was swollen, the one that she received the vaccine in; Nervous; Respirations were fast; Pounding in her left breast; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (Patient) reported for herself. A 75-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, Lot Number: EN6206, NDC number and expiry date was unknown) via an unspecified route of administration, in left arm on 03Mar2021 at 13:00 (at the age of 75-year-old) as 1 ST DOSE, SINGLE for COVID-19 immunization at workplace hospital. The patient medical history included dry eye which was diagnosed for 2 years. She had dry eyes, they just gave her doxycycline which was new medication she has to taken for 20 days. There were no concomitant medications reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 03Mar2021 the patient had experienced pounding in her left breast. On 03Mar2021 19:00 experienced nervous and respirations were fast, on 03Mar2021 23:00 arm was swollen, the one that she received the vaccine in. On 04Mar2021 attack to her lymph nodes, problem swallowing on an unspecified date. It was reported that the patient received the PFIZER COVID vaccine, she wanted to report her event. The patient received the vaccine, then at 17:00 there was no reaction. At 19:00 the patient felt like she was nervous, like her respirations were fast, pounding constantly inside of her left breast for maybe 2 hours. At 23:00 when the patient went to shower she was unable to put her arms up. When she got out her arm was swollen, the one that she received the vaccine in. The patient felt like she was having a problem swallowing when she laid down for bed. The next day around at 6:30 the side that the injection was swollen up to her elbow and she noticed the swelling was up to her neck just in that part. The patient called her primary care provider and at 4:30 she got an appointment to see her doctor. When the patient went to the doctor appointment, the swelling was going down in the up to the elbow. The patient doctor said there was an attack to her lymph nodes, she was told to take Tylenol every 6 hours and today was day 7, and there was still swelling and some pain. The patient's doctor told the patient that she still need to have the second shot. What would be the reaction from the second dose. The patients doctor said the caller would be sick for maybe 2 days after the second dose of the vaccine. The patient arm was still swollen and she still had pain, what should she do. The patient doctor said to take a Tylenol but the caller is allergic to so many medications she was afraid to take it. The patient asked if we have MODERNA'S number so she could call them for her friend. Reporter reported that the patient stated she was a certified medical assistant. The patient prefers to be contacted via phone. When the patient got the vaccine at 13:00 she felt great, then at 19:00 when she was cooking , she felt short of breath, she did her respiration exercises, she was relaxing. The problem was on the left breast it was like a pounding constantly. This only happened for a few hours. There was a pain when the patient tried to put her arms up. The next morning it was around 10:30 the swelling in her left arm was up to the patient elbow, it was tight up to her ears, on the left side of her face. It was very hard and very swollen, even on her neck. That was when she called the doctor, who then diagnosed her with the attack on the lymph nodes, the doctor checked under her arm and there was a pain when she pressed. The patient had swallowing problems at 2:00, she was nervous, she drank some water, they said to drink a lot of water and she went to bed. The patient was scheduled for second dose on 24Mar2021. The patient never took Tylenol, she did not have pain that was killing her, just swelling. There was not any relevant test performed. No adverse event prior to the vaccination. The patient visit to physician office but not emergency room. The patient received the treatment for the attack to her lymph nodes. The outcome of events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are possible; No further information is expected
